title: Perfect Visit

The hotel was very clean and the housekeeping team was very friendly too. The breakfast was very good and the hotel is close to a lot of fun places

title: good hotel
text:

There is a lot of atmosphere in the hotel hall.

title: Terrible experience not worthy of a Marriott hotel
text:
We went to this hotel because ours had flooded and they relocated us to this one.
The hall is terrible and always full of people, suitcases on the floor, children running and nothing pleasant.
The rooms are TINY, we couldn't get two people at the same time to move from the bed to the bathroom, which, by the way, is also tiny and only closes with a rickety sliding door that almost touches the foot of the bed. There is no place to store clothes and we had to avoid suitcases to move because they cannot be stored anywhere
But breakfast deserves a separate chapter: The worst of MY ENTIRE LIFE and I haven't stopped traveling in 50 years. Paper plates, plastic cutlery, paper cups and thousands of people fighting for a bagel. There are never free tables, but people, even without tables, can continue to enter, resulting in real masses of people with breakfast in hand trying to find a place, sitting in the hall or even on the floor. If you are lucky enough to find a place to have your breakfast you will have several people with their plastic plates full, standing close to you and your table looking at you and waiting for you when you get up.
The food is scarce and extremely bad. There is no bread, no toast, just hard bagels and no hot milk.
The elevators are always full and take forever...
I had booked a much better hotel and ended up, against my will, relocating to this one. On my anniversary and with the hope of having prepared this trip for months...
They block a deposit and tell you that it will take a few days to be returned, but it's been almost two weeks and we don't know anything about the refund of the money... there are other clients who have been waiting for months.
I will never stay in this hotel again.

title: 🔝
text: Everything was exceptional, from the courtesy and professionalism of the staff, to the room, new, tastefully furnished and equipped with all comforts, ending with the breakfast, rich, varied, plentiful and of high quality... Sixth time in New York, first time satisfied from all points of view... I will definitely return

title: Great location with minor drawbacks
text:
The hotel is in a great location for a city trip in New York/Manhattan.
It only takes 5-10 minutes to walk to Penn Station/Madison Square Garden. As is usual in Manhattan, you can get something to eat/drink every few meters (e.g. Taco Bell etc.)

The room is bigger than I thought. We had enough space for 5 nights. There is also plenty of storage space in the bathroom.

There is shampoo etc. in the shower, everything is clean.

The bed is comfortable.

A big MINUS point is the very loud ventilation. Regardless of whether the air conditioning/heating is on - the ventilation does not turn off and is very loud. You can even hear it through earplugs. I find that very annoying.

As often mentioned in the reviews, another problem is the elevators. There are only 2 for 14 floors. Sometimes you wait 10-15 minutes for one to come and then sometimes it stops at almost every floor and takes forever for the door to open completely and close again.

The breakfast is edible but that's it. It's not tasty. There's far too little space and it's completely overcrowded. We traveled in the off-season and still had to eat standing up. The selection is OK - typically American. The scrambled eggs tasted like unseasoned liquid plastic. And as is (unfortunately also usual) all cutlery/crockery is disposable. Breakfast was included, so it wasn't that bad. If we had paid extra for it, though, I would have asked for it back. 

All the staff are very nice. 

There are two WiFi options - the free ("slow") one is completely sufficient and it loads everything without any problems. Videos etc. too. 

All in all: a hotel that is great to book for a city trip if you're a deep sleeper and like to eat breakfast outside :-)

title: Just not worth the money. At best this is 2 star
text:
I had to make a point of writing this review after just one night stay here. 

The rooms are small. Way smaller than advertised. The TV in the room faces the wrong way to everything else. Don't know who designed it.

The worst parts. Up all night as the rooms are not sound proofed. Gaps around doors means you hear EVERYONE who comes through the hotel.

Went down for breakfast (,not enough elevators for the volume of people so be prepared to take the stairs)

Breakfast. We had no where to sit so had to take breakfast back to our room and eat it on the bed, using the paper plates provided by the hotel and plastic cutlery. 

Overall. Worst hotel I've stayed in for a long time, and it's just been one night. Moving to a different one from today!

title: Not a bad wee spot
text: We travelled over from Ireland for a few days in New York.  One of our party had wheelchair access and we found it quite easy to get into the lobby and to the rooms. It is quite local with plenty of bars and restaurants close by. 10 minutes walk to the main times square areas and 5 minutes walk to Madison Square garden.  The breakfast was quite good. Scrambled eggs and sausages available. With plenty of crumpets and bagels which were refilled regularly. Nuts , fruit and cereals also available. Lobby staff and security at night were very friendly always greeting people and wishing them a good day. There is also a shop in the lobby for snacks and drinks. The hotel looks very modern and the beds were comfortable. There is a large TV in the room with lots of channels. There is safe and a fridge which came in handy. There is a coffee machine also. The price is very reasonable for the location. My only qualm is that the bar staff did not interact at all with the guests. We sat at the bar and were charged double for our drinks although this was later put back on my card when I complained although it took a few days. This led us to go elsewhere for more drinks as we felt we could better service elsewhere. Which we did. Apart from that it was great. I would definitely return which and plan to do in the future.

title: Great experience
text: This is a great hotel in a good, safe location. Some of the negatives in prior reviews were not issues we experienced. The room was good, bed comfortable, staff wonderful, lobby was friendly and fun. The breakfast, 6-11 am, had many choices, including nuts, fruits, dried fruit, oatmeal, bagels, muffins & potatoes for my vegans. The only downside is the elevator floor button sometimes did not work properly.

title: Fantastic location in NYC
text:
Stayed for three nights prior to taking a cruise from Manhattan. It’s an excellent location off 8th Avenue and minutes from Penn station making it easy to take the train from JFK. Friendly and informative checkin just in time for the nightly drinks reception which was very welcome. New York room sizes are rarely big but our room was more than big enough, very clean and a good bathroom. Breakfast was included and there was plenty on offer from an early hour meaning we could get out exploring as soon as possible. We never had any issues with the lifts nor did we see any less fortunate people hanging around the street. 

It’s handy for everywhere and with the traffic as bad as it is in NYC is a great base for walking which is the best way to see the city. Easy walk to Circle line for the boat tours and if you don’t have masses of luggage the Manhattan Cruise terminal is walkable and probably quicker than by taxi. Subway close by and plenty places to eat and drink nearby - The Tailor Pub is good and only two minutes away. Highly recommended

title: Never again
text: Camera piccolissima anche per gli standard di NYC, climatizzatore talmente rumoroso da sembrare un trattore, letto comodo più o meno, colazione dozzinale con camerieri che ti tolgono tutto dal tavolo appena ti alzi per prendere qualcosa dal buffet. Per non parlare poi degli ascensori … ore di fila per salire o scendere. Insomma per me è un no, mai più

title: Ultra quiet
text: This was probably the quietest Manhattan hotel I’ve ever stayed at. For two straight nights, I didn’t hear a single horn or siren, and the HVAC operated in total silence. Would definitely stay here again just for that. Rooms were small, of course, but spotless and comfortable.

title: Reservation but no room for us!!
text:
Booked to stay in this hotel. 1st timers in NYC celebrating our 15 year anniversary. Arrived at hotel after a long journey only to be told casually they had no room for us and they booked us into a different hotel across the street. Very inconvenient and not a great start to our trip! 
The lobby area was extremely busy.. we did get to experience breakfast at the hotel, it was OK for free. Hot items were cold and it was too busy. Disappointed,  but thankfully we stayed in the Voco across the street and ended up liking it better.

title: Theft
text: The hotel receptionist asked for a $100 deposit. We paid by card, they assured us that this is a normal procedure and after the stay the money will be returned within 2-4 weeks. 4 months have passed. We did not get the money back. So disappointing, don't recommend.

title: Enjoyable stay in a good location
text: I really liked this one. Walkable to a ton of stuff, including Hudson Yards, Penn Station. Clean, quiet room with a comfortable bed. Helpful staff in midtown. I plan to use this location again. The free breakfast had a lot of decent options. This is a good choice for the area.

title: Treated badly
text:
On the day of my check in I received an email at around 7am from an Anthony Li from the hotel saying my credit card wasn't working.  The email said I had to update it by 6pm or the reservation would be canceled and to please reply all to confirm.  Just one hour later at 8am I updated my CC in my account via the Bonvoy app.  I emailed back at 8am (10hrs ahead of the deadline!) saying I had updated it and asking if there was anything else I needed to do.   No one replied.  I landed at JFK that evening and logged in to the Bonvoy app only to find the booking had been canceled.  I called reservations and they offered no sympathy or help to the situation.  They said there was nothing I could do and I needed to book a new room.  So I did.  Then I got to hotel, checked in and then when I got to my room I see it's a tiny room with a double bed even though i'd booked a King Studio.  The check in person knew he was downgrading me but did not say anything.  I called the front desk and they said "it's because of availability".  I said "but why wasn't I told that at check in, I booked a King".  They realized they had screwed up when they looked up my Marriott status I think so they offered me some points to make up for it.

What a terrible experience. 

On top of this, the hotel is fine, but it is way too crowded with not enough elevators. If you stay here be prepared to wait 5-10 minutes on weekends just to get in an elevator.  

I won't be staying here again after this experience.  The front desk team need to shape up.

title: NYC trip with friends
text: The rooms are small but extremely clean. Breakfast was good  and  included and although I'm not a fan of the disposable cutlery/plates the coffee was probably the best I ever had in NYC. The location is central and just 2 blocks away from Penn station. I stayed in that neighborhood before the pandemic and you see a lot more homeless and pot smokers in that area. Would stay again.

title: Non andateci
text: All’arrivo abbiamo pagato 300 dollari a titolo di cauzione. Quando abbiamo lasciato la stanza ci hanno detto che la somma sarebbe stata restituita entro pochi giorni. È passato più di un mese e non abbiamo ricevuto nulla, nonostante numerose mail e solleciti che abbiamo mandato alla struttura, che non ha mai risposto, e a Booking. Comportamento inqualificabile. Sconsiglio vivamente questo albergo.

title: Good except for the elevators
text:
Overall, this was a really good hotel for sightseeing in NYC. The beds were comfortable. The room was quiet. The free breakfast wasn't great but adequate. Our family of 4 enjoyed having 2 queen beds as opposed to 2 doubles that many NYC hotels have.

Unfortunately, there is one major issue in this hotel: the elevators. There simply aren't enough elevators to service the whole hotel. After waiting an inordinate amount of time in the lobby, you just hope to get a spot going up to your room. We were fortunate being on the 2nd to top floor because it made getting a spot on the elevator easier. We stopped at at least 3 floors after there was no more room to cram even one more person. If you need to catch a show or a flight or be anywhere on time, allow at least 30 mins to get from your room to the lobby. Or just plan on walking down the steps.

title: Amei a experiência, quero voltar!
text: Hotel maravilhoso, bom atendimento, limpo, confortável e em ótima localização. Tinha um funcionário que falava português então foi tudo bem tranquilo. Ficamos uma semana por lá, tinha café e um chocolate quente delicioso free na recepção.

title: Great experience
text:
The Hotel is well located, close to many attractions but not in a extremely crowded area. The Vessel, the High Line and Times Square are few minutes walking from the Hotel. The metro station is also one block away. Although the Hotel is well located, it does not seem to be located in the safest street, and during the night we did not few really safe. Bare in mind this is not the safest NY area, but the Hotel street is particularly empty during the night.
The rooms were clean and well maintained, the service was really good, including the reception which was always helpful. Congratulations to Pedro, which was making the tables ready for breakfast and was always friendly.
The breakfast was good but it was the same every singles day and there were not many options.

title: buena estancia, mal servicio
text:
La estancia estuvo fenomenal, el hotel bien en rasgos generales, desayuno variado, buena atención...

title: Gutes Hotel in Manhattan!
text: Das Hotel hat uns gut gefallen. Sauberes Zimmer, nettes Personal, gute Lage, leckeres Frühstuck. Zwischen 17 u. 18 Uhr gibt es die Bierstunde. Das Hotel kann mit dem Transfer zum Flughafen helfen. Gerne kommen wir wieder!

title: An oasis of customer service
text: Great experience at this really conveniently located hotel. Upon check in we were invited to 'Happy hour' at 5pm with free drinks and snacks....they had live music, beer, wine, cheese,  cold cuts, etc. Wasn't loads but really set the tone of a customer focused hotel and to get anything in Manhattan untaxed, never mind for free is nothing short of extraordinary! The rooms are small but perfectly formed and have all you need and large rooms in manhattan are as rare as free drinks! Best thing though was the staff from the receptionist on check in (who later served me my free drinks) the breakfast team and the lovely porter with the mohican who quickly and efficiently stored our luggage after check out, they're all an asset to the hotel....they seem to really enjoy their jobs and I'm guessing there's some good managers here who know how to look after their team!

title: 🔝

title: Great hotel in Hell’s Kitchen
text: This hotel was a great stay despite being in the middle of DT NY. The room is small and basic, but clean and comfortable. Ask for an inside room facing courtyard for a quieter stay. Would recommend and will stay again. Free beer and wine nightly at the bar during certain hours.

title: Prezzo eccessivo per quanto offerto
text: Camera minuscola e insufficiente per posizionare le valigie. Letti comodi e camera abbastanza silenziosa. Colazione delirante: posti a sedere insufficienti per il numero di persone che speso sono costrette a portare  cibo in camera. A seguito di questo anche il traffico nei 2 unici ascensori presenti (usati anche dal personale di pulizia) durante il periodo della colazione porta a lunghe attese. Posizione comoda a pochi passi dalla metropolitana e dal Madiaon Squarr Garden. Personale cordiale e disponibile

title: Good hotel for tourists, would recommend
text:
The hotel is ideally located for tourists in New York City, less than a 15 minute walk from Times Square, The Empire State Building, Hudson Yards and Broadway, and only 5-10 minutes from major subway lines that will take you to other attractions. Penn Station (and Maddison Square Gardens) is literally around the corner, which is also very convenient.

The hotel staff are extremely friendly, from the front desk through to the porters and housekeeping. The lobby has a nice modern feeling and the rooms are clean and modern, and reasonable in size for Manhattan.

Breakfast food is ok, however the range of cooked options in the buffet is pretty limited (scrambled eggs, turkey or spicy sausage, and a potato option) and some more fresh fruit would be good.

In conclusion, I would definitely recommend for a tourist visit to the city (and it would probably be suitable for business too). You could get breakfast out very easily but would end up paying much more.

text:
Hotel in strada non molto bella come posizione con mokti homeless fuori. L' entrata dell hotel è anonima e sotto il livello strada. Camere piccole e anguste con pochissimo spazio per i vestiti. Colazione caotica con ressa e pochissima scelta, ascensori da incubo!!! Sconsigli l'hotel alla clientela europea.

text:

La habitación tenía el inodoro junto con la ducha dentro del baño pero la pica estaba dentro de la habitación.

title: Good  Experience
text: The hotel was clean, quiet at night,  staff was friendly and the breakfast was fresh and good.  It is centrally located and was average priced for the area. We met friendly people at breakfast from different countries which was a plus. We had no issues and would stay again.

title: A convenient way to visit NYC
text:
Overall a very good hotel, matching the expectations for this price range. Good service and friendly staff. The room we had (double queen beds and a sofa) was of a good size and with all the expected amenities. The only issue we had was with the noise in the room, probably due to a very loud AC which we had to keep on given the high temps in NYC during our stay.
Breakfast was good and with decent choices, but ideally you want to be there relatively early on to avoid the big rush!
The location is perfect, at walking distance from Times Square and many big attractions, and with very easy access to public transport. 
Overall this hotel is highly recommended if you envisage a touristic visit of New York at a decent price and with good quality).

But finally i wouldnt come back because they took my money from the credit card which is ok, but they still block this amount of 1700 USD for 2 weeks now, for no reasons. text: I really average accommodations, which I could look past, but the check in process was a NIGHTMARE. Waited over four hours after repeated concerns that the room would be ready “soon”. I understand they don’t need to honor early check in requests but don’t make us wait, hoping, when clearly it will be a WAIT and they’re nowhere near ready. We wasted half a day in their lobby, and watched nearly every other guest who came in after get checked in ahead of us. No explanation why their rooms were ready but ours took 4 hours. Plenty of other options in the area at this price point.

title: Pour jeunes actifs
text:
Hôtel agréable situé près du Madison Square Garden, de Macy's et Penn Station. Très pratique pour rayonner sur New York et sa région, mais aussi arriver de l'aéroport.

L'hôtel est propre, confortable, mais les chambres sont mal isolées au niveau sonore. J'entendais mes voisins et les ascenseurs!

Le staff est sympathique mais pas toujours très professionnel.

La salle de gym est bien équipée, mais malheureusement en sous-sol. En revanche elle a l'avantage d'être ouverte 24h/24.

Attention, depuis la crise Covid le quartier est devenu un peu dangereux. Je suis tombé sur des gens se piquant dans une rue parallèle.

En résumé bien pour des gens jeunes et actifs, moyen pour des personnes mûres souhaitant de la tranquillité.

title: Great breakfast and quiet rooms
text:
We arrived at 3pm..the room wasn't read but we sat in the lobby on some nice couches with some fresh lemon water. They didn't tell us our rooms were ready so we had to go ask which was annoying.  They made sure our rooms were on the same floor and just  a few doors apart.   The room was not huge but it is NYC but plenty of space. I wish the bathroom had a regular door not a barn door but it was fine.  Never heard a sound from outside which was a very busy street so that was great!!
Breakfast was great, such a big area with plenty of seats inside and outside.  They had eggs every day with a different meat and potato each day. I love how long you have to get breakfast it is served until 11!!  I also love how they have a cold or hot water machine. great for filling up my water bottles for the day. In the evening you can get a glass or wine or beer for free from 5-6pm.  They have out some veggies, dip, cheese and fruit.  It was a nice little snack.
The hotel was about a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square, Just FYI I would avoid going down 36th to get to 7th Ave, that street was a bit creepier then 37th, or 38th or 40th.  Great stay!!!!

title: Très bon hôtel remarquablement bien situé!
text:
Cet établissement est situé à 2 pas de Time Square et permet de circuler dans Manhattan avec beaucoup de facilité. Le personnel est attentif dans l'ensemble mais les différentes Concierges manquent souvent de connaissances précises et donnent parfois des réponses surprenantes! La chambre était confortable bien que petite et la propreté irréprochable chaque jour (6 nuits); la salle de bains était bien équipée, un peu étroite. Happy hour de 17h à 18h au bar de l'hôtel. Service de demande de taxi rapide et efficace. Navette très intéressante pour JFK (85USD forfaitaire).
Le paiement se fait à l'arrivée avec une caution de garantie de 300USD mais en fait on est débité qu'après le départ de la somme prévue pour le séjour.
Un grand buffet de petit-déjeuner...un peu chargé entre 8h et 9h!
Un hotel plutôt sympathique et remarquablement bien situé.

title: Decent
text:
Nice clean hotel centrally located in Manhattan, close Times square, Broadway, Hudson Yards, The Highline and very close to 34th Penn metro/train station so easy to get around. We got there from Newark by NJ transit for $15 and walked 2 blocks, went back to Newark in the early hours so got an Uber for $65, took less than 30 minutes at that time.

Rooms are small but this is central Manhattan and adequate for 2 with room for cases. Clean, pretty new fixtures and fittings.

Only complaint is the breakfast, just hopelessly too small. We ended up going when it opened to save the stress of findiung an table. But can't complain otherwise and would recommend it to anyone!
