title: Great staff with flare and smiles. Small rooms in Manhattan but a good visit.
text:
All my reviews use the same format, so it isn't just a general review, but breaks out each area and then a total score. Any questions, please let me know.

This was a business trip for a single traveler. 

ARRIVAL:
Arrived at the hotel from LGA. This hotel is a great location in Manhattan in the Garment District and a 12 minute walk to Times Square. My Uber from the airport took about 40 minutes which is not bad seeing as it was mid-afternoon. 

CHECK-IN:
I was quickly checked in by a friendly and smiling front desk. They provided me a high-level overview of the hotel layout, including the bank of elevators that had a gremlin in it (wasn’t working right), and the complimentary happy hour (wine and beer tasting) as well as the breakfast. Super easy process took about 4ish minutes. 

PROPERTY:
The hotel shares with another Marriott property, so it CAN be crowded, especially in the morning for breakfast. The lobby, floors and elevators all were clean and managed. My room rate was $297 per night for three nights, which is not bad at all in Manhattan. The reason why I chose this was a meeting we held with a customer. They had already booked here, so to make it easier, we did as well. Normally I stay at the now closed Midtown Marriott. I have no complaints about the overall property in general

ROOM/ACCOMODATIONS:
If you have been to NYC, you know that many rooms are small. I will say that the rooms here are the smallest I have encountered. Just over 248 sq/ft was my corner room 521. There is a couch with a desk area facing the window once you enter, a VERY small closet, fridge and microwave, coffee maker, you know the standard. There is NO place to put your suitcase away and only two drawers on each side of the bed to put clothes away. I always unpack. Doesn’t matter how many or few days. 

The bed is low to the ground, more so than other hotel beds, unless you are in Asia. It was a king and it was comfortable. 

Bathroom is super small, which was to be expected given the overall room size. Nice shower and a clean bright white. 

The overall lighting in the room, from the fixtures could be improved in the couch/desk area. It is a little bleak. 

STAFF/SERVICE:
As I said before, the staff was always super friendly and helpful. From the bartenders to the meeting room staff, EVERYONE was great. Other high-end properties in Manhattan need to take a visit and see how they do it. 

FOOD:/BAR:
I visited the bar once late at night after coming back from a dinner. Drinks were good. Ordered an old fashioned and a vodka-soda with cran. All were done well. 

There is a grab and go area to the side of the check-in counter with the basic snacks, water, etc. 

Breakfast is a tad crazy with ALL the people from both hotels converging on it. One morning I grabbed some eggs, sausage and potatoes. All items were very salty and I could not eat it so I grabbed a banana and a muffin. Blueberry was good!

SUMMARY:
For the price the hotel was nice. Rooms were on the small to tiny side, so not fitting for more than one person, but you can make it work in a king if you don’t mind using the couch for your suitcases. 
I loved the staff. That made this review easier for me. Would I come back? Yes, if I needed to be right in this area. I would not turn people away. 

Scoring:
CHECK-IN: 10/10
PROPERTY: 7.0/10
ROOM: 6.5/10
STAFF/SERVICE: 10/10
FOOD/BAR: 7.5/10
OVERALL WEIGHTED: 8.2/10

title: Navigating Confined Quarters: A Frustrated Review of SpringHill Suites in NYC
text:
As a distinguished traveler with a discerning taste for luxury accommodations, it is with great reluctance that I must concede that my recent stay at The SpringHill Suites in NYC was not my first choice, as the local lodging options were unfortunately limited.

Despite my initial reservations, I found the hotel staff to be exemplary, providing a level of service that was both hospitable and efficient. The check-in and checkout process was a breeze, and the staff went out of their way to ensure that my needs were met throughout my stay.

However, my experience with the facilities left something to be desired. The elevators were an endless source of frustration, with long wait times and a constant crush of fellow guests that made it difficult to move between floors in a timely manner.

The rooms themselves were also a point of concern, as the lack of space made it difficult to navigate without feeling cramped and confined. Moving the small chair in the room was a logistical nightmare, as it effectively blocked the exit and made it impossible to leave without first rearranging the furniture.

To add insult to injury, the bathroom door was a flimsy sliding barn door that provided little to no privacy, compounding the overall sense of claustrophobia that permeated the room.

Despite these shortcomings, I must concede that the limited breakfast selection was passable, if not entirely satisfying.

In conclusion, while The SpringHill Suites in NYC may not be the ideal choice for discerning travelers, its top-notch staff and reasonable amenities make it a viable option for those willing to overlook its shortcomings.

title: Mixed Bag
text:
I don't like to be totally negative so let's start with the positive.  We found the front desk staff to be warm, inviting, and accommodating upon our arrival and departure.  The lobby was spacious and clean.  We were in town for 4 days and the hotel location was convenient to all of our predetermined destinations.  The breakfast was a bonus and satisfactory as we are both not huge breakfast eaters.

Now to the reason we will not return.  How small can a room be to qualify as a hotel room?  Our hotel room could best be described as a micro-room.  We had NO space for our luggage (2 small carry-ons) and did not have room enough for 2 people to change clothes at the same time.  Our room was so small that we had to open the room door to set up the ironing board.  Shame on Marriott for offering this to their clientele.

title: They do not return deposit. No devuelven depósito.
text:
I stayed at the hotel in January.  It's almost April and they haven't returned my $300 deposit.  I communicated by email asking for the OPERATION NUMBER and they did not send it to me.  I need my money.  When they send me the operation number that shows that they have returned my money, I will change my rating. 

me hospede en el hotel en enero. ya casi estamos en abril y no me han devuelto el depósito de $300 dólares. Me comuniqué por email pidiendo el NÚMERO DE OPERACIÓN y no me lo envían. necesito mi dinero. cuando me envíen el número de operación que demuestre que han devuelto mi dinero cambiaré mi calificación.

title: Friendly Professional Staff
text: We traveled to the Fairfield Inn & Suites 36th St with a large group. Staff was amazing & accommodating. I watched Jeffrey at the front desk engage guests cheerfully night after night; and Omar at the bar was friendly, engaging, and professional. I rarely thank hotel staff for their courtesy and professionalism, but this team was top notch. Can't say enough about them.

title: Reasonably priced good hotel
text:
Excellent stay. We stayed four nights in King room with terrace. The room had lovely comfortable bed, small sofa, safe, wardrobe with ironing board and steam iron. Fridge and coffee machine and desk and chair. As the room was small it meant one side of bed was close to glazed terrace door and the door to bathroom at the foot of bed so it was quite difficult to move round at night. The bathroom had lovely hot shower and large toiletries and towels and hairdryer.  We had booked room with terrace but as it was cold weather we did not use it and the cold came through the glass so we had to keep the blind down to keep the room warm. That said if the weather was warmer the terrace would be a bonus. The room was clean and housekeeping came everyday. Sheets changed on the third day. There was huge TV and provided you had own subscriptions easy to access Netflix etc. Good free wifi. 
I agree the lift is slow but we were only on 2nd floor so could walk down stairs. The breakfast had a good choice so long as you got there before 9. It was always busy and 7.30 seemed the best time. They also do a happy hour at the bar 5-6pm where you can get small glasses of wine or beer and nibbles. Very nice. We only did it once as we were normally out till later. 
On our last day we booked transfer to JFK with the lady in the hotel. We had minibus that went to another hotel to collect more passengers, we had been advised of this when we booked. It was 75$ and took 1hr 45 but we were travelling at 5pm and had been told this was busy time. We were happy with this. We had got to the hotel by yellow cab from JFK and that was $96 incl tip. 
The hotel staff were ALL happy & helpful. 
The hotel is conveniently located to Times Sq etc and to Penn St subway to travel further.

title: Average
text:
I’ll start with the positives with the hotel, Firstly, i thought the staff were great, always happy to answer any questions we had and were generally helpful. The rooms were an adequate size and well equipped. 

Now for the negatives… The elevators at times take an AGE. There was some evenings we waited over 10 minutes to get one. The breakfast each morning was rather chaotic, there was not enough seats for guests, to the point that guests were having to either stand with their breakfast or take it back to their room. Lastly, there was an airport transfer stall in reception. I enquired and booked a transfer to Newark airport. I was told by the lady that this was a car that would pick us up direct to go to the airport. When we were picked up it was actually a bus which then stopped at another 3 hotels then went to the airport. I felt ripped off as a taxi would have actually been cheaper. 

I’m returning to NYC in October this year but based on this experience, i’ll opt to stay at another hotel.

title: Crowded, chaotic and hot!
text:
While the hotel staff are nice and accommodating, it does not make up for the negatives at this hotel. 
As other reviewers have mentioned, the breakfast is crowded and I was never able to get a seat. The elevators take forever. 

My room was clean but it is oddly arranged so it feels super crowded. Housekeeping brought new towels but didn’t empty the trash. 

The worst part of this place is it is so hot!!! Stuffy everywhere you go and my room is unbearably hot. I opened the window but it reeks of weed outside. The conference room is either freezing or stifling. No in between. On my last morning here there was an issue with the hot water but I didn’t care because a cold shower was the only refreshing part of this very stuffy room. 

It’s close to Penn Station and Newark airport but the Crown Plaza on this block is a much better choice!!!!

title: Great place to stay in Manhattan
text:
So, I finally had the opportunity to spend a couple of days in NYC, and then set about choosing a hotel. I knew I wanted to be near Times Square; wanted something clean and comfortable, at a fair price, with no hidden charges (curiously, Pres Biden addressed such monkey business in his recent address).

I found it here! Clean, with courteous service, good location, very fair price by NYC standards.

The room was tiny—but hey—it’s Manhattan. I was solo; it would have been cozy for a couple. No problem at all.

My only negative was the elevators—only two for a 12-story (or so) building. Coming down at ‘morning rush’ was a challenge. Fortunately, I was on the second floor, so frequently walked down rather than waiting.

Breakfast was an expansive continental—plenty to eat, fresh and constantly replenished. I didn’t really need lunch!

Highly recommended!

title: Better than expected!
text: I visited Springhill Suites with my Mum during February half term. Having read some of the reviews, I was worried about this place but honestly, I needn’t have been! From the moment we checked in, to the moment we checked out, we had everything we needed. The staff are extremely friendly and there is a lovely atmosphere around the hotel. Everything was smooth and efficient. The room was cleaned everyday and we were given fresh towels, which after a long day of exploring was so wonderful. The breakfast has lots of choice (but it is very busy) and was replenished regularly. People have made complaints about the street it’s located on but we never encountered any problems, even very late at night. Unfortunately, no matter where you go in the world, there will always be things you dislike but this was never an issue nearby to the hotel. It was extremely quiet at night when sleeping. It’s in a great location - we walked to everything! Absolutely perfect for what we needed. Thank you so much for making our stay so easy and stress free!

title: Grata surpresa!
text:
Chegamos ao hotel sem muita expectativa, pois não achamos muitas avaliações e fotos. Mas, o hotel nos atendeu perfeitamente bem! Fica muito bem localizado (36 com 8), perto de diversos pontos turísticos e da estação de metrô (Penn Station), sendo assim, até o trajeto do aeroporto JFK até o hotel foi feito de metrô (com o air train).
O quarto é muito confortável, cama e lençóis macios, TV grande com acesso aos canais locais e Netflix e Amazon prime. O ambiente era bem limpo e possuía serviço de camareira todos os dias. O banheiro tem uma boa ducha. O único ponto de ônibus observação é o barulho do ar/aquecedor.
O staff do hotel também foi ótimo! Sempre solícitos e prontos para atender.
O café da manhã é bem farto e com bastantes opções, um diferencial em NYC.
O hotel também conta com academia e com um lounge, que possui programação com música ao vivo e bar.
Como nosso voo partia de madrugada, fizemos o checkout e deixamos as malas guardadas até a saída para o aeroporto.
Gostamos muito e desejamos voltar!

title: Excelente energia e muito atenciosos
text: Estivemos hospedados em trânsito por uma noite, pois chegamos em NYC em 26/01/23  e tínhamos reserva no The Manhattan Club. Funcionários muito atenciosos e prestativos,muito alegres. Gostamos do café da manhã incluso e fazem um "happy hour"toda tarde.  Com certeza retornaremos.

title: Pleasant stay!
text: I just completed a weekend stay at the SH Suites Times Square South and had a pleasant experience. From check-in to check-out, the staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel is in a great location - a few blocks from Penn Station/Moynihan Train Hall which is ideal for Amtrak, NJ, and LIRR rail services. Rooms are cozy with modern amenities. Breakfast is served daily until 11:00 and offers a decent selection of pastries and select hot items. I would stay here again.

title: Would stay here again!
text: By no means the most glamorous of hotels but I enjoyed my stay here and I thought was good value for money. Bed was comfy, room and showers were clean, all the staff were very friendly, wifi worked well the whole time and had a bar downstairs which people actually used. The breakfast was ok, pastries, cereal and fruit were good but the limited selection in terms of hot breakfast.

title: Family vacation to NYC
text:
My family (wife, 10 and 8 y.o. sons, and I) stayed here whilst visiting New York. We stayed there for five night.
First of all logistically the vote was really in a good location; central to most tourist attractions, although relative distances still apply! After landing at JFK my family and I got the subway to Penn Station, we were then about 3 blocks away from the hotel! We easily managed to carry our luggage the required distance.
I had read online about the homeless problem in the neighbourhood. There were a few homeless people on the street but I have seen far worse in most cities in the world and no one even looked in our direction. The street is pretty busy and I didn’t feel unsafe at any point. 
If you plan to go to Madison Sq Gardens it’s an ideal location. I went to watch the Knicks and it was a 7 minute walk to the entrance we had to use.
The staff at the hotel are fantastic; exceptionally friendly, helpful and courteous throughout. The hotel will store your luggage if arriving early or leaving late. The foyer of the hotel is very modern, has a good vibe and is a nice place to have a coffee or drink at the bar. The foyer also acts as an overflow area at breakfast which does get exceptionally busy. If you are happy to wait and stalk a table then it’s nothing to worry about. The breakfast was plentiful and varied and was replenished very quickly. 
There are two lifts for guests at this part of the hotel to use, which can be a bit of a wait but it was never more than a couple of minutes. Returning from breakfast to your room from the lifts there can be a big line but we went straight out after breakfast so was not an issue.
The gym is bigger than expected and well equipped.
The rooms are as to be expected for Manhattan. They are small but well equipped. The usual amenities can be found, including a massive TV compared to the the size of the room! Admittedly if you have a lot of luggage like my family did it can become very tight but we spent hardly anytime in the room. Rooms were very clean and tidied every day.
Without any doubt I would use this hotel again!

title: Convenient
text: Great hotel in a good location. Super close to everything. Walked to most places, the big station isn’t far. Team was nice, room was spacious. Breakfast was alright, but enough to get you going. Would stay again

title: Would definitely recommend.
text: Super clean.  The bed was comfortable. Room had blackout shade which was really nice. The street was quiet in the AM, also a plus in NYC. The shower was good. Friendly and helpful staff. Great location. Super awesome free breakfast.  Eggs, sausage, toast, waffles, bagels, hash browns, and muffins. Juice and coffee. Really great way to start you day. Subway close by. Starbucks close by. Would definitely recommend.  10/10.

title: Great location for easy access to all attractions
text:
Stayed for 4 nights . Family of 4.  Rooms are compact but adequate . Staff were really lovely and friendly at all times . Breakfast was crowded but could grab and go so was handy to get something into you before heading out for the day . Penn station and port authority bus station within a short walking distance , perfect for easy access to go sight seeing . This hotel is not on Times Square it’s 15 min walk away . Street where hotel was has homeless people sleeping under an area lined with scaffolding. At first they are intimidating but they actually never bothered us during our trip and there is a huge police presence all over the city so felt very safe at all times . 

I would stay here again it’s a very clean and modern hotel for NYC .

title: Plues and minues
text: Actually more in the Garment District than Times Square but within walking distance, there is reasonable and easy access to Penn Station and Madison Square Garden, Bryant Park, etc.  Small rooms, good bathrooms, but what's a big drawback are that there are no dressers/drawers in the room. If you are staying for more than a day or so, you will be living out of your suitcase and hardly room for more than one in the room to begin with.  Generally long wait for elevators, and most rooms have an unappealing view.  Breakfast can be crowded but they have a generally good assortment of hot and cold products and a nice amenity.  The bar is quite small, but at least there is one, and free wine and beer from 5-6 p.m.  Generally a safe-feeling neighborhood.

title: Lovely, Reasonably Priced Hotel
text:
Easy shuttle from airports, convenient for Times Square, Theater District and Macy’s parade. Nice, hot buffet breakfast. 
VERY nice and helpful staff!
Suites are quite small, but this is NYC!

Easy 3 block walk to Bryant Park.

As I also must write at least 200 characters I am continuing to babble on. Enough?

title: Poor -  Not worthy of Marriott Brand Name
text:
I am an experienced solo traveler and i am also a long term platinum Marriott member. I chose this Marriott based on location, reviews and price. unfortunately the experience has been very poor.  

Negatives - too many 
1) Communication - I reserved through Booking site and communicated my arrival time and a week in advance provided details that parcels would arrive for me could you accept and would an upgrade be available as a platinum member.  Confirmation received from hotel CS that of course we will look to upgrade you and will accept your parcels. What actually happened upon arrival. No upgrade available and no record of my platinum membership.  Parcels which arrived was told we have to charge you for accepting your parcels $10 per parcel , which was never communicated by CS agent in comms after stating this the front desk then said $40. I refused as one of the parcels had been opened and items were missing. No investigation was launched even though i made a formal email complaint to the head of hotel manager.  
2) Infrastructure - 5 elevators but only 2 work for the "springhill suites" 20 rooms per floor and only 2 elevators, just does not work and you stand around for 10-15 minutes waiting for an elevator, Not acceptable.  Room if it was an upgrade or downgrade was small extremely by NY standards and quality of working items such as lightbulb and fittings in shower were broken and had not been replaced. Should be part of the normal cleaning check process after a guest leaves.
3) Customer service levels : I do expect better knowledge and attention to details of a customer request.  if i choose a Marriott branded hotel it must reflect the brand value and it has now devalued my view as a platinum member and what message does this reflect to others who are non members.  

Positives :  None

title: November 2022 Stay
text: My friend and I stayed at the SpringHill Suites New York Manhattan/Times Square South in November 2022. The hotel is very close to Penn Station, which was perfect since I had an early train. The lobby is inviting and the room with the queen bed was well-designed and contemporary, with all the amenities I needed for this stay. I wish the room had a better view and there was a little bit of a wait at the elevators during check-out, but neither of those things detracted from the stay. The best part - the front desk staff. I wish I remembered their names but they were so kind and fun, complimenting the outfits we wore to the Beyonce-themed party we went to and providing excellent hospitality! I would stay here again.

title: Thank You Tirza!!!!
text:
New York City was my dream trip and the Springhill hotel in Manhattan was also a dream! All the staff was great. 
I want to specifically thank Tirza, she was the nicest person to me everyday, super kind, nice and available at breakfast! I was really well impressed!! 
All the best wishes for her and everyone at the Hotel.
Thank you for turning my visit to NY even more special!

title: Great Customer Service and Location
text:
Our stay at Spring Hill Suites was fantastic! The location was perfect to walk to our activities at the Javits Center and the Manhattan Center. Plenty of Deli’s and markets near by to pick up supplies. Also the Break Bar is just around the corner where you can smash your glasses/bottles when u are done. Our King room had a balcony on the 2nd floor, which made it easy to come and go and not wait for elevator. And the room was quite large. There was plenty of room to maneuver around bed, had a sitting area with sofa, also had Coffee machine and mini refrigerator. We booked the “Pizza Package” and got coupons for a free Cheese Pizza each day we were there. 
The staff were so friendly and helpful. Bellman staff was great: Jonathan was a lifesaver and carried my bags upstairs when my room was ready and got me ice. Jessina was always cheerful and had answers to all my questions. Christian was always cheerful and entertaining. The bartenders were fun. Annery was very attentive and kept me company while I was waiting for my friend. Omar was also very friendly and enjoyed hearing about our fun at Bravocon.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!!

title: Great location. Shady Street
text:
The location of the hotel was great. 2 blocks from Penn station and MSG. The homeless people at the corner of 36th & 8th wasn’t a great first impression for my parents who were enjoying their first trip to NYC.

My main gripe was the bill. We booked 3 double rooms through booking.com. When we arrived we checked in and 2/3 rooms were upgraded for free at no fee according to the concierge. When we checked out we got our 3 identical bills. When we got back to the UK, the 2 bills that were upgraded for free were more expensive on the exchange. I’ve tried to contact the hotel with no luck. It’s ridiculous to be not get any contact when they’ve taken £4000 from us. Such a shame…

title: So nice
text: The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. So thankful for it during NYC marathon weekend. It was an exhausting and fun time but i needed to rest in the evening. The air could have been cooler, but everything else was perfect. I picked the wrong side of the building for views. My view from the top floor was a building under construction across the street. I just didnt know. Info on the website didnt say that.

title: Great location and comfortable rooms
text:
Excellent location and comfortable rooms

The customer service in the check in was exceeding expectation; if I not forget, Jeffrey was the one who assist us with the check-in. 

The rooms are very comfortable. The blackouts of the windows ere awesome. 

The location was perfect; two blocks from Penn station. Excellent restaurants close the hotel. The breakfast is including with the rate and is very good. 

We definetely consider this hotel in next visit to,NY.

title: Don't stay here. Awful worn out mattress + awful service by hotel and Marriott Group.
text:
Don't stay here. We had an awful worn out mattress and ongoing terrible customer service. We're still fighting for a refund two month later.

We had such bad sleep the whole trip. My husband was sore every night/morning from the mattress as well. I cried the first two mornings of our trip because of the pain from the mattress.

The staff put notes on our file about the issue for the housekeeping manager to see and work out some solution. Nothing was done to fix the issue. The night manager said all the mattresses are the same in every room, so no point trying to move rooms.

We've been trying to get a partial refund on our stay. The hotel says they have no record of our  issue in their system and deny we ever had an issue. We have photos of the mattress. 

Marriott Group customer service keep ghosting me when I ask to talk to a manager or someone higher up. The main hotel manager never responded to my emails. Another manager has been difficult to deal with. She forgot about a phone appointment with my husband. She gave me the run around on refund process and refund request. She led me to believe we were getting a refund. When my husband talked to her on the one she told my husband she would have just left the hotel if our situation happened to her. We did try to move to their Fairfield Inn & Suites which is in the same building but they wouldn't move us. We couldn't move hotels as we paid in full.

The manager says she checked the mattress (I doubt this) and sees no issue with it and feels nothing warrants a refund (we asked for 50%). The photos we took show the issues. We had to sleep on bunched up comforters to minimize the pain from the hard lumpy, saggy mattress.

The hotel denies any issue was brought up by us even though they put a note on our file. We're fighting for a full refund now. 

On top of that, they "upgraded" us to the room we had originally booked and paid for so they had us in a smaller cheaper room than what we actually booked and paid for. I was excited to see the upgrade only to walk into the room we originally booked.

Avoid this hotel. Once they have your money they don't care if you have issues and they won't compensate you for anything no matter how bad it is.

title: Nettes Touristenhotel, zentral gelegen in New York
text: Das Hotel liegt super zentral zwischen Times Square und Hudson Yards. Wir konnten unsere Ziele entweder zu Fuß oder mit einer kurzen Subway Fahrt erreichen. Das Hotel ist schön gepflegt und sauber. Die Zimmer sind ansprechend und gut ausgestattet. Das Personal im großen und ganzen freundlich (bis auf die Rezeptionsmitarbeiter, die wirkten bei unserer Anfrage sehr lustlos sie zu bearbeiten). Das Frühstücksbuffet bietet eine typische amerikanische Auswahl. Leider wird das Essen auf Plastikteller und -besteck serviert, was im Jahr 2022 nicht mehr nachhaltig ist und den Geschmack des Essens beinträchtig. Der Frühstücksraum ist eigentlich riesig, aber zu klein für die vielen Hotelgäste. Somit war es angebracht gleich zur Öffnung am Buffet zu stehen, um einen Platz und Essen zu bekommen.

title: SCARY STREET / DRUG ADDICTS AT BOTH CORNERS
text:
Rooms are nice and clean. The staff is good, very attentive. However, if you walk to either 8th Avenue or 9th Avenue, be prepared to step over drug addicts and homeless people. It is NOT safe. There's a Police Dept next to the hotel but its CLOSED permanently. 

Stay away. Your safety should come before a cheap price.

title: Busy area, quiet room
text: Definitely get a king room. The queen room I stayed in night 1 was really small, but the second night I got a king room and it was much better. Staff is great (especially Jeffrey at the front desk!), and though this hotel is in a busier area of Manhattan, walkable to many sites, it was quiet and I got a great night’s sleep.

title: Quick visit to New York
text: What a fantastic staff! They are friendly, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are clean with updated features. The housekeeping service is efficient. It’s a convenient location for walking around Manhattan and the most frequented sites.

title: Bem localizafo, café da manhã muito bom!
text: O hotel tem funcionários atenciosos, decorações modernas e o quarto para padrão NYC tem tamanho OK (não dá pra deixar mala no chão pois impede passagem). Possui cofre, secador de cabelo, tábua e ferro de passar, frigobar e até microondas. O café da manhã é realmente ótimo e tem muitaaas opções boas. Ele é super bem localizado e várias coisas se faz a pé, ou pelo metro Penn Station que fica há 1 quadra. Mas infelizmente o chuveiro do nosso quarto era horrível!!!! Vazava água para fora do box, tinha a dispersão de água toda errada fazendo com que até lavar o cabelo fosse tarefa dificil já que não vinha pressão. Eu reservei pelo booking e quando chegamos lá fomos avisados que por qualquer site de reserva não constava as taxas municipais e estaduais, então o custo da diária ficou 35% mais cara, fazendo 3 diárias saírem por quase 6mil reais na conversão atual de dólar... o que até para NYC é muito caro!!! E com o chuveiro ruim como estava, nos fez ficar chateados, teríamos pedido para trocar de quarto com certeza se soubessemos antes que ia ficar tão caro.

title: DA EVITARE!! E state attenti agli addebiti in più che fanno “””erroneamente””” sui vostri mezzi di pagamento!!!
text:
Io e la mia fidanzata siamo stati in questo hotel 11 giorni a settembre e posso dire quanto segue:
- Allarmi antincendio che scattano erroneamente di notte,
- il servizio di pulizie che dimentica le porte delle stanze aperte dopo aver finito di riordinarle,
- lo staff che addebita importi in più sulle carte di credito fornite per pagare le camere al nostro arrivo e poi non fa nulla per sistemare subito le cose..questa la cosa più grave!!!! Tra l’altro stiamo leggendo sia tra le recensioni di booking che di Google non esser la prima volta che capita a quanto pare…,
- cattivi odori nella hall dell'hotel probabilmente derivanti dal fatto che cucinano a pochi passi da lì senza aver un buon sistema di areazione (?),
- tossicodipendenti che si bucano in vena fuori dalle porte dell'hotel (questa non è colpa loro ma tant’è….)
Quindi per concludere….oh mio dio. DA EVITARE! MAI PIÙ!

/

Fire alarms that mistakenly sound at night, housekeeping forgetting room doors open after finishing, staff mistakenly charging credit cards provided to pay for rooms, bad smells in the hotel lobby, drug addicts piercing their veins outside the doors hotel, oh my god. .. AVOID! NEVER AGAIN!

title: Gran Hotel
text:
El hotel es muy lindo por dentro, cuenta con lavandería, las habitaciones son cómodas y el servicio de limpieza es excelente. Tuvimos un inconveniente en donde nos quedamos atrapadas en el ascensor, sin embargo el hotel se portó muy bien y lograron sacarnos rápidamente a su vez que nos compensaron por el incidente. 
El desayuno es muy bueno, tiene bastante variedad y es de buena calidad 
El hotel se encuentra central a manhattan, a pocos minutos de Times Square y cerca de una estación de subway. 
Volvería 100%

title: Nice Hotel - Not Nice Location
text:
We stayed for 4 night recently and have some plus and negatives:

PLUS

Staff were lovely and attentive always smiling 
Room was nice, not very big but ok for us
Breakfast was included and whilst chaotic was nice choices and the food was fresh

NEGATIVES

Location  - Its Hells Kitchen not Times Square and the area is covered in Homeless People and Mentally unwell people - To the point you have to walk round people lying in the middle of the pavement, Its not well lit and certainly not clean which is awful to see 

The breakfast whilst nice was so chaotic some people struggled to get seats whilst others put bags on tables to stop people sitting on empty seats and no staff to say otherwise

The bar whilst nice to look at is super expensive along with the onsite shop it looks really lovely but is pricey so bring in your snacks or water etc 

Housekeeping only came twice during our stay even tho it said daily and the second time only replaced towels - didnt empty bins or make the bed which i found strange but not a big deal

Overall a nice hotel but not in a nice area - as two women travelling together i didnt feel 100% safe walking back to the hotel after dark

title: The squeaky wheel gets the oil!
text:
Excellent location, close to many tourist attractions including the subway, Penn Station, Times Square, Empire State Building, Macys and more!
Yes, the rooms are small - this is NYC, folks.  ALL hotel rooms are small here, unless you're paying a small fortune.  The elevators are busy at peak times (did I mention, this is NYC, folks, you're not in Kansas anymore) but we never had to wait excessively long.  Yes, the breakfast room is crowded (this is NYC...), but we were always able to find a table (for 4) and they kept the food well stocked.  
There's an in-room safe and, contrary to the hotel's website, it's free.  You also have a mini-fridge and microwave in each room.  The fitness room is very well stocked with high quality equipment.  We had the pizza package, and the pizza was huge and delicious - they deliver it to the hotel.  Only thing is, you have to pay $5 each if you want any toppings!  
Now...about the air conditioning.  In our first room, it didn't work.  The engineer came up, said he reset something, blah, blah, and it still didn't work.  We kept hounding them, and on the second day they moved us to another room.  It worked completely fine with no problems for the remaining 5 days.

title: Dejligt hotel med rigtig søde om servicemindet personale
text:
Vi boede 3 nætter på dette hotel. Af et 3-stjernet hotel at være,  er hotellet virkelig godt. Fine store værelser som var pæne, rene og velholdt. Pænt badeværelse med kar og brus. Gode madrasser i sengene. Pænt og rene på fællesarealerne. 

Meget alsidig og dejlig morgenmad - med bl.a. mulighed for kaffe to go.

Personalet i receptionen er meget imødekommende og hjælpsom m.v. Deres to unge fyrer som står for transport/taxi service er også super effektive :-)

title: Not sure it was the most cost-effective option
text:
I would not reccomended it. Rooms are clean but definitively too small. The location, although in middle town, is not  reccomendedable since its road is periferical and badly attended. 
This was my fourth time in New York City, therefore I think I know manathan quite well to say that for the same price (335 Usd per night) you would most probably get better options. 
Our Room was  so small that we had several injuries hurting against everything. 
My personal preference remain downtown in the financial district since it can offer a better contest with higher standards.  This might be subjective and probably others do not like communiting from downtown. In any case, even if you would like to stay in middle town, I would take a deeper look into the options available to see if you can find something more competitive. Positive note the breakfast which had many options for all and a good choice of milks also for lactose intolletants or vegan.

title: OK. Great location
text:
Confortable bedroom. 2 King size beds. The room is small for 4 guests with suitcases but clean, modern and well equiped.
Tiny bathroom makes problem for a family.
No real door between bathroom and bedroom.    
Breakfast ok. 
People at the front desk are nice.

title: Uncomfortable neighborhood
text:
I stay in NYC a lot, always at Marriotts, and this is the first place I've stayed where I deliberately didn't walk at night because the neighborhood was so skeezy.  Many homeless now line 36th street.  I saw two arrests and I saw a guy peeing on the sidewalk -- FACING the sidewalk, not peeing into a corner.  I myself live in a city and am comfortable with urban life; I have stayed in San Francisco, Portland, OR, Santa Monica and many places with a lot of homeless and I am not a "Karen" about city life.  However, this area did not a good feeling.  Just too many people with too much unpredictable behavior 

The hotel staff was incredibly nice, the breakfast buffet incredibly generous,  the rooms were perfectly adequate (after I got moved to the second room because of inadequate cleaning of the first), the AC, while noisy as a jet engine, worked great and I appreciated the open-able windows.  Unfortunately, as a solo woman I will not be staying here again.

title: Super location and service!
text: Super location and service!  We had a wonderful stay here.  We arrived by train at Penn Station and had an easy walk to the hotel.  ALL the staff were helpful, friendly, and clearly working hard to make our stay nice.  Felt very "safe" too with the surging omicron variant.  The property was clean, bed is comfortable, bathroom layout is great, and the lobby is inviting.  The refrigerator and microwave in the room was handy.  We especially love hotels that provide breakfast, but this hotel is big (serving a lot of people for breakfast), so try to come early if you can.  It was an easy walk to great restaurants and Broadway shows and also an easy location to be picked up by Lyft or Uber.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: AC not working, service unresponsive- took days to look at it and let me move rooms.
text:
Terrible night's sleep. AC was broken. Told front desk on first night and they said it was too late (~10pm) and there were no alternative rooms. 

I told them the next morning and asked if they could fix. They said they would. I'm on a work trip, so I'm getting back around 10 every night after team dinners etc. I come back, AC still not working and they didn't look at it even tho they said they would. They said they'd send someone up- I waited until midnight before finally just turning off the light.

Same thing the 3rd night- I've talked to the front desk many times, always promising someone would come, no one ever did. Finally someone did, but the AC still didn't work and they moved me to another room.

BTW, as others have said- the elevators are excruciatingly slow- mostly because there's only 1 elevator servicing a huge chunk of floors, but also partly because you're required to badge into your floor using your key- and the badge reader seems really finicky so you have people trying to figure it out whilst other people are waiting to get on/off. Given there's a doorman greeting people in and out, it seems like they could relax the elevator badging as a way to speed things up.

Also, the AC in the gym seemed broken, as was several things in the breakfast room- so seems like the hotel is in disrepair.

title: Teeny room, air con didn’t work however I would still recommend!
text:
We arrived for 2 nights; our room was not ready which was fine as we were early; the baggage staff were fantastic; very friendly, informative about the city while putting them away while we headed out for the day.
When we came back; checking in was quick and pleasant. 
The room was a bit of a shock; absolutely teeny for 2 adults and a teenager. Understandable for New York but having just come from a Marriott in Boston it felt very confined. We had to stack our bags behind the door which made me a tad nervous in the event of a fire and fast evacuation!
The AC didn’t work but we rang the reception and they sent someone up within minutes. They provided a fan which was great but a tad noisy.
The breakfast was perfect for us. Good orange juice; good coffee; cereals, bagels - no toaster; pastries; eggs, bacon, yoghurt, waffle’s. Something for everyone in our group.
We were out all day but with kids you have no choice but to be back in the hotel early which means you can either hang out in the reception area which is doable; or come up to the very small room. The reception area is great; spacious; they accept food deliveries and they have a bar area. 
We stayed on the 12th floor so street noise levels were less of an issue but we did hear people complain about the noise from lower floors.
Overall I would stay here again; good location; great staff; good price; good breakfast.

title: Good option for a budget traveller
text: Just returned after a 5 night stay family of 4, 2 children 6 and 14. Couldn't fault anything about the hotel. Hotel was bright, clean and staff were very helpful. Rooms are on the small side but who comes to NY to stay on your room. We had no AC the first night. Staff tried the best to accommodate us but because of how busy the hotel was were not able to be moved until the next morning. Staff gave us fans, bottled water and refunded the night's stay. This wasn't asked for and think this was a fare offer on the hotels part. Breakfast is very good, plenty of options and if like us having a complementry breakfast saves a good couple of hundred dollars during your stay. Overall a bery hood central hotel and wouldnt hesitate to returnif we vidit the big apple again.

title: Short Stay
text:
Good short stay hotel NYC
Had room with 2 queen's but very tight squeeze if 4 of you in room ( which there was for us ). No room for bags / emptying luggage
Would not personally recommend for longer stay unless you had x 2 rooms 
Staff lovely
Had a problem with air con but this was rectified quickly
Breakfast was ok but don't go down at 9:55 as food will be taken away by 10!
Beware of the bed frames, corners very sharp, hardwood

title: Good stay and reasonable: All you would want for the price
text:
We travelled in February to see Elton John at Madison Square Garden and this was a perfect place within walking distance. The room and bathroom was small, not atypical for NY,  but modern and clean. Comfortable beds and free breakfast. At that time we had to show proof of vaccination to go to the breakfast are.  Very accommodating front desk staff. 
Are staying again this weekend to see a Broadway show.

title: Wrong room, air conditioning didn't work
text: We were placed in a tiny room (not a suite) even though I paid for a suite and called the desk to inquire and asked to be moved to the correct room.  The room was very hot and we were told it was normal.  They gave us an oscillating fan.  So, we slept in a room so small we had to close the door and stack the suitcases behind it, sweating, hot and uncomfortable.  I placed a complaint with the company and have not heard back.  I'm also a Marriot member.   Very dissapointed.

title: Reservas canceladas indevidamente!
text:
Ao chegar no Hotel Springhill by Marriot Manhattan fomos informados pela recepcionista que nossas 2 reservas haviam sido canceladas pois não comparecemos em tempo hábil, no dia 02 de maio.

Ocorre que dias antes entramos em contato via email com uma funcionária Marriot chamada Telma e a mesma garantiu ter deixado uma nota em nossa reserva: "Deixei uma nota em cada reserva a indicar que irão chegar ao hotel no dia 3 de Maio por volta das 10 da manhã".

Pagamos uma diária a mais exatamente para podermos entrar no quarto mais cedo e ao chegar no hotel nos deparamos com essa desagradável surpresa.

Depois de muita "luta" fomos realocados para quartos diferentes e inferiores do reservado no site hoteis.com além de termos que pagar por um valor maior que o contratado. Nunca mais reservo um hotel da rede Marriot.

Quase ficamos na rua em New York!

title: Promedio
text: El desayuno no es bueno, lleno de gente y la calidad de los productos deja mucho que desear, todo es empacado y nada es fresco, las habitaciones aunque pequeñas son limpias y las camas SÚPER CÓMODAS, la ubicación,aunque cerca de todo, no me gusto mucho pues hay unas calles cercanas en las que siempre hay personas vendiendo droga no se siente seguro

title: A éviter
text:
Hôtel bien situé mais pour tout le reste je vous le déconseille. Chambres étroites pour 4 personnes. Salle de bain minuscule 2 m2. Pas de bouteille d eau dans la chambre. Baignoire fissurée, mobilier de la salle de bains cassés. Air conditionné extrêmement bruyant ( j’ai dû la coupe et rester dans une chaleur étouffante)
Petit déjeuner peu varié et répétitif.
Dommage pour un hôtel situé au cœur de la Manathan.
Une chose est sur c est que nous n’y remettons plus les pieds.

title: Petit déjeuner plus que moyen
text: Hôtel bien situé notamment pour aller sur Times Square, chambres petites et vite encombrée avec les valises. Ménage effectué chaque jour. Mais le point négatif : le petit-déjeuner : difficulté pour trouver une place assise même a partir de 8h00 le service se fait avec assiette et gobelet en carton et des couverts en plastique !! Heureusement qu’il s’agit d’un 3 étoiles !! Et les offres en plats sont tout aussi pitoyables : pain bagel rassis pas de réassort régulier et le peu de choses proposées sont de mauvais qualité voire immangeable !!

title: Bon rapport qualité prix
text:
Hôtel très propre,
Notre chambre était un peu petite mais correctement équipée.
Petit déjeuner bof dans une ambiance un peu cantine ….
Bien situé. Personnel sympathique.
Dans l’ensemble, très correct !

title: bon rapport qualité prix
text:
les chambres sont propres et la décoration est moderne .
Petit déjeuner répetitif mais complet ! Le personnel est très agréable.

Attention à la barmaid qui est super désagréable si vous oubliez les tips ! Habitude à prendre pour nous français , et à priori la bienveillance ce n'est pas son truc. Au lieu de nous expliquer gentiment le fonctionnement, elle m'a littéralement envoyé bouler devant tout le monde lorsque je suis revenue.  Je suis allée boire mon verre ailleurs :)

title: Good value in Manhattan
text:
Two night stay during Spring Break to see two Broadway Shows. Basic rooms (we had two). Small but very typical for Manhattan. Comfortable bed and very quiet.
No view. Slow elevators during rush hour. Breakfast was fine. Better then most Marriott breakfasts post pandemic. Saved us a bunch of $ vs eating out. Nice neighborhood. Easy to get to Macys and also up to Times Square-bring your walking shoes!

title: Fantastic - Next Stay in July Booked
text:
My stay was from 4/09 - 4/11, it was an amazing stay.  Arriving on 4/9/22 from Vegas on an overnight trip I knew I would need to wait a while for a room to become available so I could check-in early.  I did wait a few hours and a room did open up and was on my way up.

The room is small, yet functional.  I have stayed at Margaritaville in Times Square and those rooms are super small.  I only need a room to sleep, eat a snack, shower, etc...  I don't spend a lot of time in the room, functional at a great rate is the check box that needs to be hit.  The room was on the 8th floor with a terrible view, I don't care, it was quiet.  The bed was comfortable, the shower hot, and there was a free breakfast.

The hotel is a combo of Springhill Suites and Fairfield Inn.  I'm not sure how it it split up, there is a cost difference at the same address.  The breakfast was typical Springhill Suites/Fairfield Inn, nothing amazing, it is free, what to expect.  I think the lobby is kind of cool, open and airy.  There breakfast is served on the 1st floor, and there is also a bar area, and a small snack area for purchase.  The location was safe, I'm a native New Yorker, and a deli was within a short walking distance in either 36th or 34th street and 9th avenue.  I did find the partner parking garage a bit odd.  I did validate both nights, and the rate noted on the website says $60 a night.  I paid $80 the first night, and $40 the second night, I had to pay for each out privileges'.  Not sure why the difference between days.

Everyone was super friendly, I think the Manager of the Property spent a little extra time with guests also.

title: 1Just an overall great stay
text: It was so cold in Manhattan  I just landed at 7 AM January 8 from San Francisco.  I got to the hotel about 10 AM and Tian,allowed me to check in early.  He acknowledge, I am a Marriott Gold member and was extremely helpful and friendly during check in.  He was there all morning as well as other staff to answer all my questions every time I passed by the front desk.  The only issue I had was there were not enough elevators for the amount of guest.  I was lucky enough to be able to use the stairs.  The room was NY small but was very clean and had everything I needed.  It was walking distance to places I was meeting family members.  I like the closeness to Penn Station, I usually fly into Newark so it was very convenient.  The breakfast provided was very good for being free.  Even the pizza that was provided with the room was good. Thank you Marriott and thank you Tian.

title: Worst hotel EVER!!!
text: First the elevator was broke and we was force to walk up and down the stairs to the 14th floor.  Second our heat was broke in our room and it was 29 degrees outside. We where offered extra blankets for the night.  Third, the rudest most unprofessional staff member  cursed at me and no one did anything about it! I will NEVER stay here again and STRONGLY recommend on one else does neither

title: Não recebi de volta o valor do meu caução/After 15 business days, still haven't  received my deposit back.
text:
Check-in foi rápido, sem queixas. 
Os quartos (reservei dois, pois éramos em 6 pessoas) possuem duas camas muito confortáveis, porém somente em um deles possuía cofre.  
Café da manhã bom. 
Localização excelente, fizemos tudo a pé. 
A única questão é com relação ao valor do caução: foram 150,00 dólares de caução por cada quarto, totalizando o valor de 300,00 dólares, que foi passado no cartão de débito, e que após o check-out, o valor seria reembolsado entre 7 e 12dias úteis. Hoje, 15 dias úteis após o meu check-out, não recebi o valor de volta. Procuro por email de contato, porém não existe, somente um número de contato, que infelizmente não tenho como ligar pois já estou no Brasil. 
Gostaria que essa questão fosse resolvida, e que alguém da rede Marriott/Springhill Suites entrasse em contato comigo. Obrigado.

title: Parfait
text:
Nous avons passé 7 nuits dans cet hôtel très bien situé et nous le recommandons vivement.
Tout était parfait:
Le personnel est agréable et disponible. Les chambres sont modernes, propres et très bien équipées. 
Le ménage est fait tous les jours. 
Le petit déjeuner est répétitif mais très utile pour commencer la journée. 
Nous reviendrons!

title: Shocking Service
text: We stayed at this hotel from the 20th to 23rd December. We paid for our reservation on arrival and paid for a bar bill at the end of our stay. Then was charged again for the reservation after numerous emails calls to the hotel manager To O’Neill Justin we have had no response whatsoever to sorting this issue out

title: Full
text:
Estuvimos dos noches , nos recomendaron un restaurante cercado de una lista que tienen , nos fue pésimo ( Diana ) , se llama el lugar 

El ascensor es súper lento , no da a basto para tantas personas 

El desayuno es aceptable pero estaba demasiado lleno 

La habitación no tiene vista , es pequeña , el baño muy incómodo , la luz terrible

title: Went beyond my expectations
text:
Great location in the flower district and very centralized
Hotel was brand new so it seemed new furnishings and a well equipped gym.
Staff was helpful and courteous as the hotel had just opened.
Rooms were nicely appointed. The Resturant was quick and easy for breakfast.
Would go back for sure.

title: Siempre cumple las expectativas
text:
Es la segunda vez que nos alojamos en este hotel, la primera fue antes del COVID y ahora hemos vuelto en cuanto nos han dejado viajar a EEUU.
La única diferencia entre antes y después de la pandemia que hemos notado es que ahora las habitaciones las limpian un día sí y otro no, porque el resto es igual que la primera vez que fuimos.
El único defecto que le veo es que las habitaciones son bastante pequeñas, no hay sitio para guardar las cosas y la luz es muy, muy, muy escasa, apenas logras ver incluso de día, le falta iluminación a las habitaciones claramente y creo que, si bien el tamaño de las habitaciones está en la media de Nueva York, la iluminación sí la pueden corregir y sería necesario hacerlo.
El hecho de disponer de microondas y nevera en las habitaciones da mucho juego en una ciudad como NYC, pero no lo es menos el hecho de poder hacer la colada con lavadoras y secadoras, que por cierto han puesto nuevas, porque las antiguas iban bastante peor, y éstas son más modernas y tienen más capacidad.
El gimnasio es una pasada, es el mejor de todos los que he visto en hoteles de NYC, y eso que he ido a unos cuantos.
Pero lo mejor del Springhill Suites Manhattan de Times Square South es el desayuno, un restaurante enorme, súper agradable, con música ambiente, donde hay un desayuno buffet muy completo y dónde reponen de todo continuamente, nunca ha faltado nada, es sin duda el sello de identidad del hotel.
El personal, amable y agradable, con ganas de ayudar y hacer la estancia placentera.
¿Cuál es la razón de que volvamos? Su emplazamiento, ya que se encuentra cerca de todo y más ahora con Hudson Yards al lado, donde puedes ir a Whole Foods (supermercado de Amazon) a comprar comida e incluso consumirla en su restaurante, pero también puedes ir a cualquier restaurante, y sobre todo el Subway, que está literalmente al lado y desde ahí te mueves por todo Manhattan y sus distritos.
Para más datos sobre el servicio del hotel, se rompió uno de los ascensores en plena festividad de Thanksgiving, y estuvimos cuatro días del fin de semana y festivos con un solo ascensor, y en cuanto tuvieron la pieza el lunes por la mañana, lo repararon, y eso no sucede en cualquier otro hotel de NYC, lo digo con conocimiento de causa, porque ya me ha sucedido en otro hotel de la cadena Hampton Inn (a la que no pienso volver, por cierto). Nos tocó subir y bajar escaleras nueve pisos durante cuatro días seguidos, pero se entiende que algo así pueda suceder.
Volveremos...

title: Fun night in NYC
text: My wife and I were catching a concert in NYC and found this great hotel just south of Times Square. The location was perfect and was an easy walk to the concert venue. The staff was friendly, helpful  and went over and above to help make our stay enjoyable. The room was comfortable, clean and had a great layout. We only stayed one night but wish we spent the entire weekend.  I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting the Times Square area.

title: Not bad, but be prepared for a lack of space
text: Great location, but with a very tiny room. I guess that’s to be expected in a major city hotel – you get what you pay for. Had everything we needed for a one-night stopover, but the size of the room left quite a lot to be desired. Very helpful front desk agent (Daniel).

title: Best location and service for for its price
text: The hotel's location, staff, and rooms are just the best you can get for the relatively cheap price they charge. I had a blast staying there and their breakfasts are really good. On my last day, I was helped to print some documents for my work, leave my bags for a couple of hours after check out and get a taxi service to JFK for a cheaper price than Uber. And what is best I got contacted by the hotel's Complex Assistant Front Office Manager, Daniel Arizmendi about me leaving my passport in the room almost right after I checked out. He CC'ed all the necessary staff members to make sure I get my passport when I would come back to pick up my bags. It all just felt really well and positive at this hotel.

title: Cramped and crazy - stay elsewhere
text:
This hotel shares its facilities with a Fairfield in.  I landed late and arrived at the hotel at 1am. To my surprise the lobby was still fairly busy.  When I approached the front desk, the agent did not even "hello".  After providing my last name, the agent could not find my reservation (which was odd, since the Bonvoy app even showed me my room number).  Needless to say, after a long flight this wasn't what I wanted to hear.  After some confusion and cross-checking my confirmation number from the Bonvoy app, the agent found my reservation and the key associated with my room - since I had used mobile checkin, the key had already been made.  I was told the hours of the breakfast and sent along my way.  

When I got to my room, I was pretty shocked - there is literally nothing "suite" about the set up.  It is a really cramped room and cramped bathroom, and there was no shampoo in the room but it was so late, I didn't have the energy to deal with the front desk so I used the provided conditioner for my shower and went to bed.  Unfortunately there were all kinds of noises throughout the night - high pitched squeals, banging, and other mechanical noises (i.e. from the AC or other building equipment).  I woke up with a terrible headache.

Every time I went through the lobby it was packed with people, luggage, and complete chaos.

Fortunately I only stayed here for two nights.  Skip this place and stay elsewhere.

title: If only I could give it Zero Stars
text:
This has been one of the worst hotel experiences in my adult life. A lot of things were wrong and very little effort was done from the hotel staff to make it better. 
We initially booked the new "SpringHill Suites by Marriott New York Manhattan Chelsea @ 140 West 28th Street", however, the opening of this location was pushed back so we were switched to this sister location.

This "sister" location was horrible and it should not be able to carry on using the Marriott brand unless things dramatically change. 
When we arrived at the hotel after a long cab drive from LGA (with our 6 month old son) we were attended by a very rude front office staff member who gave us a room with no Air Conditioning, I then came back down and instead of switching us right away, they sent us an engineer who couldn't figure it out so then we had to come back down (a third time) and finally get another room. In the new room the TV didn't work, we were told the cable box was broken and we could ask for a room the NEXT day, I wasn't planning to unpack all the baby stuff and then repack the day after to get another (a third) room. So we stayed in the room with no TV, and up to now, we haven't been compensated for this inconvenience.
Also, at time of check-in we were never told about the housekeeping policies and the fact that you don't get service until the 3rd day. So, obviously, the 2nd day we were expecting at least clean towels, but nothing, finally when we came back from sightseeing I had to request new towels and I was then explained about this policy. 
The breakfast is OK but nothing to write about.
Then, the location, I know this is not the hotel's fault but the area surrounding this hotel has gotten very shady and sketchy. There are several sketchy looking people in the surrounding streets which is not ideal when traveling with your family.
Lastly, the time of checkout is noon, and we were being bothered by the housekeeper on the last day (while putting the baby to sleep) at 1000 AM asking when we were planning to leave! come on! very rude.

title: Beware!
text: I have stayed in Marriott hotels in multiple locations in midtown Manhattan.  This is by far the worst and I will never stay again.  Very subpar for Marriott.  To begin with, the check-in associate (N***i) did not even acknowledge us, or the line forming behind us, because she was too busy chatting with a man (not a hotel guest) who was begging her to go out with him.  She should have told him to leave because she had customers, but she didn't.  Very unprofessional for Marriott.  No hair dryer in the room and it took two phone calls and 40 minutes with wet hair to get a hair dryer delivered to the room.  Stains on the carpet.  Tiniest bathroom ever with about 3 inches of counter space next to the sink.  I bruised my shin more than once on the toilet because you have to clear it sticking into the space you have to stand in the bathroom.  Also, hit my elbow more than once on the wall trying to dry my hair once I did get aforementioned hair dryer.  I know NYC hotel rooms are notoriously small, but this one takes the cake.  No hook in the bathroom to hang a robe or an item you might need to steam while in the shower.  No overhead lighting in the room except at the door.  Probably my #1 complaint is the mattress.  The reason I stay in Marriott hotels is for their mattress.  This hotel definitely did not have a Marriott-quality mattress.  Very, very uncomfortable.  And to reiterate other reviews, very shady street.  If I were not with my husband, I would not stay here as a woman travelling alone.

title: It's Your Call
text:
I stayed two nights at the SpringHill Suites by Marriott, in NYC, September 18-19, 2021…in two different rooms; the first one the engineer could not get the air conditioning to work, plus the room had too much street noise…so they moved me.
There’s a lot to like about this hotel, it’s conveniently located, especially if you arrived by train…Penn Station is close by.  It’s clean and modern, but built inside the façade of an old church adding some character.  Additionally, the staff is friendly and accommodating, the room has microwave and mini fridge and breakfast and wi-fi are included.
But there are some issues: the room is not a suite, half the very small room is carpeted and the other half has faux wood flooring, creating two ‘spaces’. The bathroom only has a shower and toilet, the vanity sink is in the living space, much like a roadside motel, and there is only one chair.  The small desk/work space is hogged by the microwave.  The room has an iron, but no hair dryer, you have to request one, there is no light switch by the bed, you have to turn out the lights, then find your way to bed.  The cold breakfast is also of the roadside motel variety; like much of this property, below what you expect from a Marriott, at any price point.  But the deal breaker, for me, was the air conditioning couldn’t be made to work in the second room either…neither room ever got a cool as the outside temperature.  One of the engineers confided that he spends most of his time trying to coax the air conditioning to work.
Lastly, the hotel is on a pretty seedy side street…not a criticism, in NYC you build where you can obtain a building site…there are three other hotels on the block.  I didn’t feel at risk, but it will intimidate some.
As the title says, it’s your call…you’ll have to decide if the pros outweigh the cons.  At the right price, this could be a very good option, with precautions.  Request a hair dryer, when you check in, if you need one, and check out your room before you unpack…if the air-conditioning doesn’t work or you’re uncomfortable with the location of the bathroom vanity…it was less intrusive in my first room, request a new room…the staff is accommodating.

title: First time I haven’t felt safe in NYC!
text: Went to NYC for reopening of Broadway! Stayed in garment district as I have before. I was shocked at the streets. Homeless/drug addicts shooting up and passed out on the street in broad daylight! One guy was bent over with 3 needles beside him.  Lord of street people at all times. This was on corner of 36th street and 8th avenue. Very sketchy! We were not at ease except in while in Little Italy and while in the show and in the hotel! Outside of hotel was a bit scary!  Stay east of 7th Avenue if you go to NYC anytime soon!

title: BED BUGS! STAY AWAY!
text: I had BED BUGS the first night of my stay. I received no assistance, containment protocols were not followed as I requested. It was very irresponsibly handled. I had to leave the hotel immediately and they did not help me relocate. I have 100+ bites all over my body.

title: Easy convenient spot in Manhattan.
text: Easy to get to from Penn Station and subway access.  Close to Times Square.   Good grab and go breakfast. Friendly staff.   Small room but just what we needed for a three night stay.  Wonderful cleaning staff left us extra towels and toiletries.   Only one elevator working on our departure day but the staff was working on it.

title: Doble cargo indebido por una estancia inexistente
text: Necesito que me faciliten urgentemente un correo eléctronico del hotel para contactar con ustedes. El señor Anthony Canna no atiende hasta el día 23 de agosto.  He llamado varias veces al hotel, pero me dicen que no hay ningún empleado en recepción que hable español, para explicarle pormenorizadamente el cobro indebido.

title: Bug issue!
text:
I normally do not ever write reviews, nor do I tell people not to stay at a Marriott property since I have always had good/great experiences (platinum member), but this was by far the WORST experience I've ever had. We checked in for one night and when we returned to the room after a night out we saw bugs on the bed and headboard by the pillows! 

When I reported this to the Assistant Manager, Nykia, she acted as if this was a common occurrence and that there was nothing in the room. Cleanliness standards and customer service here are well below subpar, even coming out of a global pandemic. Do what you will, but here is a picture of who your roommate will be if you stay here.

title: Great Stay!
text: The hotel was in a great location and the staff was amazing. I had a couple of hiccups with my check-in (not the hotel’s fault) and Victor, the maintenance engineer was great! Very polite, friendly and so helpful. I would definitely stay here again. The room was very clean and comfy. Wifi was fast (I worked from the hotel for two days). It was nice to have a fridge and microwave in the room, as well.

title: Conveniently Located Hotel – Good for a Short Stay
text:
To start with the positives, location was great. Easy access to Transport and Some of the attractions. Very quiet and calm. Room was very well cleaned and arranged for the arrival. Bed is very comfortable. Bathroom is almost new. Supply of toiletries was good quality. Enough towels available. Big flat screen TV with good choice of entertainment and news channels. Speed and reliability of free Wi-Fi was very good. Lobby area is nice and spacious. 

On the other hand, trust the hotel can do better in following areas. I arrived at midnight and found no drinking water in the room or any other area. Happened to go out looking for water; not a nice experience after nearly 24 hours of traveling (flights+ layover). 

Laundry is not free and the machines work only with quarters (25 cents coins). Fine if there was a way to secure the coins. I have seen in other places a dispenser exchanging bills to coins. Here it was not. Front desk too could not help. They managed to give just 4 coins which was not at all sufficient. So walked out again to nearby shops to look for quarters. Trust any foreign traveler will not carry coins. 

Requested an adopter to charge my laptop as wall sockets are not the same. Straight answer; not available with us. Go and look at a shop. Not very pleasing.

To conclude, I did not feel like a guest. staff at all levels very efficiently attended to the basics but did not see will /effort to do that little extra which could have made a big difference. It is a Marriott hotel so I had reasonable expectations due to previous good experience with the brand. Regrettably, staff at this property did not meet the expectations.

title: Air conditioners are broken
text:
I’m currently here in the 4th floor.  I called twice for assistance with the AC as it is not working and there has been no resolution.  The AC still does not work and no one called to ask if the temperature improved. The male at the front desk answered the phone each time.  The first time he stated he would contact the engineer.  The second time he stated perhaps the engineer can come Inside  and take a look at the AC.  That never occurred.
I d never had such an experience with a Marriott hotel.

title: Average hotel
text:
Read the reviews before booking this hotel! They are almost all accurate. Be sure to have your confirmation number readily available at check in. They attempted to check my husband and I in for a 4-night stay versus the 7-night resevration I booked.  As described in a review online, there are only two elevators for this hotel. There are two more elevators available in the hotel lobby, but they are actually allocated for the Fairfield hotel which happens to be in the same building, but in higher floors (14 and up).  One of the elevators was out of service for a portion of our stay, leaving us with long waits up and down.

Our room was a king "suite", but this studio was small, just comfortable enough for two people. Unfortunately our A/C was inoperable and, while visiting in NYC in July, this was truly a nightmare.  We called the front desk and were told that they would have someone check it on the outside... Hardly slept that night. The following morning we brought it up in person to the front desk and were told someone would come by our room while we were out... Nothing. My husband attempted to contact Marriot directly, by email and by telephone, but never heard back.  Another hot night. The following day my husband demanded a new room, which they provided, thankfully, but never any offer for a discount for the two nights we spent in a terribly hot room.

Other than those problems, the room was average. The towels shed. The continental breakfast was tolerable. The temperature of the water in the shower worked. The surrounding area has been described as "sketchy" online, but it was typical New York in our eyes. Safe enough to walk, even alone as night. My husband and I never had any issue with any of the locals. While there is a lot of seemingly homeless persons around the area, they keep to themselves.  The location was great for subway access, for which we were happiest about.

We probably won't stay at this hotel again.

title: Florida family trip been terrible because of this hotel
text: Very dirty hotel room very small with disgusting smell homeless and trash everywhere breakfast is nothing just some cheap cupcakes  even no coffee at the lobby my kids was very scared from the sketchy people this hotel not related to marriott standards by anyway everyone there fighting with the reception staff because dirty rooms and problems on room types  even if they gave you the wrong room they keep laying on you and promised they will fixed then shift changed and nothing happened and we have to go through over and over again with no change  very much disappointed never will book this hotel again we had the worst experience ever

title: Homeless staying at Springhill Suites Times Square
text: The hotel participated in the homeless program offered by New York city to shelter homeless people in hotel rooms during COVID. Unfortunately, the homeless made the hotel very difficult to live in. Lots of noise, some drug use. Especially awful was the stench of urine throughout the hotel. It looked like some of the homeless urinated in the hallways. Even outside it was the same. Public urination on the sidewalks, unbearable stay.

title: It's okay
text:
Stayed this past weekend March 6-8th. I always carefully check every details What's in the room? How big the room? ..  the room was less than 200 SQ feet The website said  265 sq feet. oh no way! The room was much more smaller than 200 square feet. 
 Food & Drink - Refrigerator, microwave, and coffee/tea maker There was no microwave , so I've asked it , they did bring it us. Over all it was okay but the room was not big enough . It's clean nice room .
The receptionist was bit unfriendly .. but I can understand that too due to this COVD19 situations .. but they could have said "Hello welcome!" :):)
That's the most important greetings!

text: First off I’ll say, the service desk reps and hotel staff were awesome! The outside pics advertised not sure how long ago they were from but I took a more recent pic. It’s so striking I actually walked right pass it. Thanks to someone before passing out kinda showed me where to go. I’m not entirely sure if this place is attached to a shelter or not, but it’s sketchy AF! The people on the street don’t bother you, in fact I was there for a few days so some would greet me but it’s awful to have to walk through nonetheless. title: Boa localização e limpeza
text:
Me hospedei por 3 dias. Café da manhã estilo americano, com bastante variedade. Hotel limpo, cama confortável. Não mexeram em nada meu e ainda me permitiram fazer o checkin antes do horário sem nenhum acréscimo.

Com certeza me hospedaria novamente.

title: Quarantined while serving the lovely people of New York.
text:
My Army unit was sent to assist the city of New York with this horrific pandemic that was reaping habit upon the World. The excitement and the unknowing that lay ahead was somewhat nerve racking. I was anxious to say the least. We packed our gear as though we would be setting our sleeping quarters out on a dock near the Hudson River or maybe Central Park- rumors flourished.
 We were all surprised and ecstatic to find out that we were headed straight to a fixed facility that would be our makeshift Medical Station (Javits Convention Center). The other glorious twist was we were getting to stay in our own hotel room to accommodate the whole social distancing rule. I loved everything about this idea. Thankfully the bus pulled up between the Double Tree and the SpringHill Marriott that would serve has our residence for a unbeknown length of stay.
Of course I headed straight for the Marriott to ground my gear, because they’re family to me; without second guessing that my name would not be on that guest roster.
 I am so grateful to have gotten to stay at such a beautiful and family friendly facility. Location and quality are two important keys to a successful business, but the people factor is priceless.
V/r,
James E. Ryals

title: Great stay!
text:
We made a very last minute decision to take a long weekend trip to NYC Feb 28-Mar 2. We booked this hotel off Trivago based off price, reviews, location and the fact that they offered free breakfast every day, something we unfortunately didn't wake up for on time once. 

We landed at Newark Airport and were delighted with the quick and easy 30 minute train ride to Penn Station. Within a 4 minute walk we were at the hotel!

Check in was simple and the staff were lovely. The room was comfortable and well equipped, our only complaint (and reason for 4 stars instead of 5) was the layout of the room. We were constantly tripping over everything. I've never tripped or bumped into things before like that in my life. We've been to NYC multiple times, we know they don't have a lot of room to work with, but it just seemed like the layout could have been better.

Asides from that, the bed was comfortable, the room was quiet, the location was great and it was exactly what we needed. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone headed to NYC for a getaway!

title: Great location, great service
text:
My family and I booked s Spring Break Trip to New York and we chose this property for our stay.  We were first-time visitors to New York and we chose this property based upon it's proximity to Times Square, the subway, amenities, and price.  We had four people in our group.  

We were able to schedule Airlink to the hotel from JFK.  We arrived late (10:30 PM EDT).  We were greeted warmly by Front Desk Staff.  They promptly checked us in, provided some key advice after we informed them it was our first visit to the city.  We stayed in a room with two queen beds.  The room was small but knew this because it is New York City.  Not a problem.  The room was nicely decorated and clean.  Beds were comfortable.  We stayed for five days.  The location was great and we could easily get to public transportation or walk to our destination.  We repeatedly asked staff for help, directions and advice and all staff were professional, helpful and friendly.  The free breakfast every morning had a very good selection and was freshly prepared and service staff was professional.

We had a great stay at this property and will return.

Very pleased with quality of hotel stay: clean, staff was very helpful and polite; lots of access to nearby restaurants, shops, etc. 
Street and sidewalks were junky and nasty, but in no way did the hotel reflect such.

text:
