title: Amazing!
text: Was able to get a room here last minute after another hotel we booked was disgusting. Spring Hill Suites is SO clean. Literally no dirtiness whatsoever. Staff was nice and willing to help as much as possible. She even informed us that they had complimentary breakfast. Amazing stay and an amazing price!!

title: Great stay in the city
text: Great location - close to subway, Broadway for a show.  Great value - the rooms are super clean and space efficient.  The breakfast was a bit too hectic and the elevators are busy but it’s nyc.  Staff are friendly - we asked for more pillows and they were there next time we went back to the room. Overall a great stay.

title: Great service
text: I never know how much to rely on reviews as people have different expectations.  I believe I have pretty high expectations but I am also realistic in my expectations. SpringHill is reasonably priced with updated and very comfortable rooms. I did request a quieter room and found the room to be quiet with double glazed windows. I was only on the 4th floor and did not notice any excessive noise. The bed was comfortable, great bathroom with quality toiletries, safe and coffee machine. The room is tight but that is expected in New York at a certain budget. For me as a solo traveller it was adequate. The staff were all very helpful, friendly and efficient. I could not fault the staff - all lovely people.  The breakfast spread was generous and varied, albeit very busy but that can be avoided by getting there early.  The room was very clean and refreshed daily. The location is great for people who want to be close to Time square and super close to Penn station to get around. I caught the train from the airport and then subway to Penn and it was an easy walk from Penn Station with my suitcase on wheels. All up a good choice of for my first visit to New York.

title: Recommend!
text: Great value for NYC . The staff could not have been more welcoming.  They were very attentive and accommodating to our needs.  For example, held our luggage after checkout until flight departure and let us borrow an umbrella :)

title: A unique service upon check in that deserves recognition and thank you! Keep this up!
text:
I’ve stayed here before and it’s always been very nice. This time I noticed a new feature that improves guest services and communication tremendously. This is something I’ve not experienced here or at any hotel before and thought it should be praised, highlighted, and potentially an idea other hotels can adopt to help improve guests stay! 
After checking into my room all was great but I could not adjust the temperature to make it cooler and as it had been after midnight I thought I’d wait till the morning to ask for their help. However, I received an email inquiring how my check in had been-asked me to simply rate from 1-10 and then a space to add any personal comments or requests. I rated highly (8)  but noted that I could not adjust the thermostat in the room and would appreciate when available someone help to adjust that. 
Within one hour of my filling out this email I received a text message from a person named Amanda at the hotel who greeted me and asked if I’d like to have the engineer come to my room right away to fix thermostat. I was so pleasantly surprised that there was someone on the other end reading personal notes-having actual correspondence with each guest really highlights individual attention to each guest. I texted back and thanked Amanda for reaching out and asked if the engineers were available that it would be great if they could come to the room and adjust thermostat . Amanda thanked me and told me the engineers would be up in about 5-10 minutes. Just as Amanda promised two very kind respectful men, engineers, showed up at my door as I showed the thermostat reading-Immediately the engineers  knew what needed to be done (The engineers Went to flip a switch in main control panel just outside the room) The two engineers were so happy to be able to help, not bothered at all by the call or the fact that it was nearly 2am! They waited with me to reassure me and show me the thermostat would now be working and Within a minute or two the temperature was adjusting to cooler and everything was working perfectly! I thanked them both for their help and they told me I did the right thing by calling and made sure I knew they were happy to help. Thank you very much to all! 

As far as the hotel itself it is a new property, very clean lobby, friendly and engaging people at the front desk, I was greeted kindly by Danae and Ivana upon check in and the front desk staff available for any other questions during stay. 

I was pleasantly  surprised at the size and layout of the king studio. The bed is comfortable, both hanging space and drawers to keep items, a couch and two small tables, a refrigerator and a microwave in the room as well. There is a large flatscreen TV with regular channels as well as, streaming apps including amazon, Netflix and Bluetooth audio for streaming music. 
The large window in the room brought in a nice amount of light and also has black out shades and curtains option for evening time. As stated above EXCELLENT guest services, attention to detail, guest request, and maintenance. 

This hotel offers a very generous breakfast each day-they go above and beyond offering fresh fruits, fruit juices, baked goods, yogurts, breads, spreads, cereals, and hot oatmeal-in addition to an entire other table of hot cooked items (I thought the fresh fruit cereals, yogurts and bread were more than generous!) I did not partake in the hot meals but noticed there was another table lined with hot items like scrambled eggs, fresh cheeses to add to eggs, waffles, and other hot items. During the week breakfast is available 6:30-9:30am and on weekends from 7-10am so to accommodate early risers as well as those who choose to sleep a bit later . 
If one has time to sit for breakfast there are plenty of tables, chairs and couches to sit at comfortably. Take your time dining or If you are on the go it’s easy to choose items and be on your way quickly. 

This generous breakfast feature seems like something that would be very beneficial to those traveling with family and  kids as there are plenty of options to choose from to make sure even pickiest child finds a few favorite choice items for breakfast and also allows time for family to sit together comfortably and enjoy breakfast before a day out in NYC! 
Thank you for everything! 
Jill

title: Très bon hôtel bien situé
text: Très bon hôtel bien situé à 2 pas de Times Square, bon accueil. Chambre très propre, bonne literie, vue agréable sur d'autres immeubles typiquement newyorkais. title: Excellent Experience - A Must Stay Hotel
text: Had an upscale feel for a great price. Staff was friendly and rooms were clean and looked exactly how pictured online. Will now be my new go to for a hotel in the city. The location was perfect for getting to explore the city, waking distance from clubs, bars, and restaurants.

title: Prepaid but no room available. Stay away
text: Reserved a room that with two queen beds. Prepaid for two nights for two bed room. When I arrived at the hotel they put me in one queen bed and room that was not clean (trash was not picked up and sheets were stained). Came down to the reception and spoke to Manager Amanda who said she didn't have any other rooms. At 11.50 pm, with two little children, I had to scramble to get to another hotel paying $300 additional per night. Bait and switch at a Mariott who knew?!. I'm in the hospitality industry , extremely unprofessional. This place is ok for single travellers, not for families with little children. (didn't even have roll away beds). Horrible is the only word I can think of. On top the reservation the manager Amanda had the audacity to ask if we were canceling the reservation (@ 12.00 Am) without even considering that we would left in the cold with Children (18 degree Fahrenheit).

title: Micro miniature rooms at a great location and friendly staff
text: Staff is very friendly. Rooms are microscopic even for NYC. You can jump from the toilet seat to the bed and from the bed to the door - if that helps :).  For people 6 ft and more in height it feels extremely claustrophobic and you tend to hit your body or hand in all the furniture all the time !

title: très bien placé
text: Hôtel idéalement placé entre Time Square, l'Empire state building et Hells Kitchen, accueil agréable, petit déjeuner copieux, chambres très propres. Le seul bémol c'est la taille ou la configuration de certaines chambres.

title: Brilliant hotel, brilliant location
text: The hotel itself is lovely and modern. Great central location with easy subway access. Breakfast was great, albeit a bit busy at peak times which was to be expected! The room was clean and tidy, with the bed being huge and comfy! Would definitely recommend and come here again if ever to return to NYC!

title: Angenehmer Aufenthalt in sehr guter Lage
text: Die Zimmer sind klein, aber gut ausgestattet. Das Fitnessstudio ist 24/7 geöffnet und ebenfalls recht gut ausgestattet. Das Frühstück sollte man in jedem Fall vor acht Uhr besuchen; es ist sonst sehr voll und das Management scheint überfordert zu sein. Sehr wenig Personal und es wird nicht regelmäßig „aufgefüllt“. Ein großer Nachteil des Frühstücks ist, dass alles auf Papptellern und Plastik stattfindet - es bleibt ein riesiger Müllberg zurück!!! Das Hotel ist stets gut gebucht. Schade, aber diese Müllberge sind nicht mehr zeitgemäß!

title: Excellent
text: Super staff right from entry to exit . Great breakfast. Staff treats you like family as if they know you since long . Highly recommended to all . Best location !free coffee avaliable in lobby releaves stress .

title: Great
text: Small, but very comfortable. it has everything you need for your stay. Location is very convenient, excellent. Room was just right. I stayed in bigger ones, but this one served me much more. everything new and well designed. Organized environment, very helpful lobby service. only caveat is about breakfast in the final 30 minutes. everything started to end, there was no replacement and the employees were in a very bad mood

title: Really enjoyed my stay!
text: I really enjoyed my recent stay at this property.  Staff was amazingly friendly and helpful and that included everyone from the house cleaning, front desk, bellman stand to breakfast staff.  Very responsive.  The room was small but typical for NYC and this style of hotel.  It was also clean and had a really comfortable bed/bedding.  Breakfast was plentiful but extremely crowded unless you went early....say around 6:30 am!  There is a nice exercise room in the basement but the downside on this was the "smell".  I know a gym is probably going to have some type of odor but this was really offensive each morning when I went down to exercise.  The only other negative is that the air system in my room would sometime vibrate so loudly that it awaken me at night.  Earplugs helped with that.  I would certainly stay at this property again.  My "complaints" should not keep you from staying at this property.

title: Great experience
text: Bathrooms and bedding was very clean! room was quite spacious . The breakfast was great and the staff is extremely nice . The location is very convenient.  Will choose this hotel for upcoming vacation.

title: Friendly staff, safe, clean, great breakfast in heart of mid-town
text: We loved this hotel. The bellman and front desk staff were warm and helpful. The breakfast was abundant and delicious. The decor was modern and fun. The room was clean and bright. It was a great value for the $$ and we would definitely choose to stay here again.

title: Excellent location, friendly staff
text:
This hotel was just far enough from the touristy area but convenient to time square, broadway shows, penn station, and the subway.  Although the walls are thin, who stays inside while in NYC?  
The havoc was a bit too loud so we turned it off most of the time.

title: Localização central
text: Hotel com localização central, próximo à Times Square (eu prefiro me hospedar nas regiões um pouco mais afastadas da bagunça do centro, mas pra quegm não curte pegar metrô e gosta do turismo de compras, Times Square, Rockefeller Center etc, a localização é ótima). title: Honey moon
text: We requested to find room in the last floors or with view and we did not found it and the breakfast during weekend very poor and the hot drink always cold and some times not available, the place for breakfast very small to cover all guests.

title: Muito bom!
text: Excelente localização, bem próximo a estação do metrô, do Empire States e do Madison Square Garden. O café da manhã é bom, no estilo americano, nas com bastante opções. title: Solid for quick weekend trip

title: Excelente experiencia

title: I had decided never to stay there again before I even was allowed into my room
text: Asked in advance for early check-in (ETA ~3 PM), arrived 3:15, front desk said "I guarantee room will be ready by 4" (an hour after our requested time), was not given key until 4:15. I did hotel housekeeping when I was younger and could have made up 4 rooms in that time single-handed. Roommate went downstairs for breakfast, dining area was over-crowed, so we returned 10 minutes before breakfast time was to end, but we were locked out. I don't remember what else they did to anger me at check-in but I remember deciding never to stay there again before we even got a key to our room.

title: Hotel Bacana Bem Localizado.
text:
Hotel muito bom, novo, bem localizado, bom cafe da manha, porem como fui no réveillon hotel estava LOTADO, era muito difícil sentar para tomar cafe da manha,era literalmente uma guerra tomar cafe nesse hotel,kkkkkkkk.
Outra coisa chata era os elevadores, não suportam o volume de hospedes em alta temporada, chegamos a ficar 25 a 30 minutos esperando elevador.No mais hotel é bem bacana, voltaria a me hospedar nele, mas se querem um dica. FUJA DE ALTA TEMPORADA.

title: Great Stay
text: I am in NYC every month for work.  I am a Marriott Elite member and always enjoy their service.  This property was clean, well staffed and a great location.  Loved the size of the TV and found the room layout to be very comfortable.  I will stay there again.

title: Great Service and Value
text:
Service and staff attitude stood out the most. Everyone was very helpful and friendly. 
Natasha at the front desk stood out - I came down at 1AM after realizing that I forgot to pack an item, she helped me find a replacement, going all the way to their supply room and back to make sure that I had what I need it. More than that - she had a smile and compassionate approach that made all the difference - thank you, Natasha!

The young man at the concierge desk was also very friendly and cheerful, even early in the morning!

Rooms were clean and efficient - everything I needed in a reasonable space for Times Square. Modern and organized feel. It was also very quiet in the rooms, I was able to get great rest in the city that never sleeps! 

Breakfast was a little simpler than I expected, especially on Sunday morning but everyone in our group could find something to eat.

title: Perfect hotel, perfect location, perfect service!
text:
The Breakfast was very tasty and varied, the room was cleaned every day. The hotel is located in a very good area, all within walking distance! 
   I forgot the car keys in the room, very helpful and sent by mail to another country!
 Very happy, I hope to return here again!

P.S. Special thanks to Roxanne for helping with the keys!!! She did everything to help me!

title: Don’t hold your breath for Room service
text: Stayed 5 nights here great location, rooms were good but small compared to luxury we are used to in Aussie land. Asked a few times for towels or room to be cleaned, just did not happen, got so bad had to front the desk staff to get it myself, even then told to go back upstairs and wait🤣 As it was 9pm and wanted to sleep, demanded manager or point me in direction of laundry room to get them now, they finally relented and got what was asked for! Breakfast was so busy and security was non existent even had homeless filling up plastic bags for their mates? Not sure if intentional but was little disconcerting, but food was good and staff were helpful even when a bit overwhelmed for the waffles!!

title: Absolutely fantastic!
text: The hotel was fantastic. The location, adjacent to time square, worked very well with the agenda for New Year’s Eve! The staff was courteous, the hotel is spotless, the facilities worked very well! I would absolutely recommend this place and will surely stay here on future trips. A hidden gem in plain sight.

title: Can not expect anything else
text: Prime location in NYC, I have stayed at other Marriott properties in NYC. I have noticed this property truly held to Marriott standards. Very Clean. Bed was comfortable. I would recommend this property to anyone.

title: Excellent location and service. Good quality breakfast. Good value for money.
text: Excellent location (close to major New York hotspots and subway stations) and service. Good quality breakfast with a lot of choices in fresh products. Always fresh coffee available. Good value for money.

title: Nice Location
text: Just stayed for 3 nights on a friends trip to the city. We were able to walk to a lot of the main highlights of the city. It was also convenient to the subway which was only a couple streets down. The staff was friendly and helpful. Although check in wasn’t until 3:00 technically, we arrived at the hotel around 10am, and they were happy to hold our luggage so that we could start exploring the city and told us to enjoy the free breakfast that morning. They even placed a phone call to me around noon to let me know they had our room ready. The free breakfast is also a plus. I would stay here again if I ever return to NYC.

title: Small rooms and crowded elevators
text: A good deal if you are into exercise. Elevator went out for several hours one day and when it did work, only 2 elevators for 12 floors of rooms. Breakfast was good variety but understaffed and overwhelmed by 2 properties worth of diners

title: Excelente Hotel
text:
Nos encantó todo, fue una excelente experiencia.
Desayuno muy bueno, con buenas opciones
Habitación cómoda y limpia
Personal muy atento ante consultas
Ubicación excelente, cerca de todo para llegar caminando
servicio en el hall muy bueno, hay disponible para tomar café, té, etc

title: Poor service let down the whole experience.
text:
- Floors were dirty, requested cleaning 3 days in a dow but none were cleaned. Specifically asked for floor vacuum for there are large dusts.
- Items were left on the floor after cleaning, hairdryer hanging onto the floor.
- Tea bag in the toilet while first getting into the room.
- Tissues not refilled, then late arrival when called for a box tissue. Had to call a second time 45mins later, then a security came to deliver it.
- HVAC was noisy, please get a consultant on the noise level.

title: Excelente hotel de ciudad
text:
Hotel bastante nuevo y muy bien ubicado, en la calle 36, entre la 8ª y 9ª avenida, a 10 minutos de Times Square y menos del Empire State y de cualquier punto en el centro de Manhattan. Tanto las instalaciones como las habitaciones están muy nuevas, cama grande y muy cómoda y limpieza excelente. El personal bastante agradable, algunos hablan español, sobre todo el personal de restaurante. El desayuno buffet está bien, tienes café americano y zumos de máquina, algo de fruta, bollos, fiambre, cereales, yogures, etc. Lo único extraño es la leche, que es como de máquina o crema (por lo visto la leche en este país no se lleva). También tienes bebidas y refrescos en el lobby para poder coger, así como para prepararte infusiones o cafés a cualquier hora. 
Los precios son caros en comparación con cualquier otro destino, pero para ser Nueva York el precio es razonable para lo bien que está el hotel y su ubicación. Lo recomendaría y volvería sin ninguna duda.

title: Amazing staff
text: The rooms are a little tight but the hotel staff — from the valet/doorman/front desk/housekeeping/bartenders/kitchen are crazy friendly and nice. Like wow, especially since the place was fully booked. Location is great and will stay again if in the area! Also, the place is extremely clean. Kudos to housekeeping.

title: Noisy Hotel with Very Long Elevator Waits!
text: In our room, trying to sleep you can hear every door on your floor shut loud and clear! Wait time at the elevators during our 5 day stay was never less than 3 minutes and many times up to 8 - 10 minutes. Another elevator or two would help a lot. There is not enough places to sit in the breakfast area and they run out of a lot of foods and coffee and cream frequently. The food they did offer that they kept up with was good. They do provide gluten free, if you ask. They definitely need more workers for breakfast as each morning their workers could not keep up with the crowds! They serviced our rooms twice and were very thorough. The air conditioner and heater were very loud so we had to turn it off at night to be able to sleep.

title: LADRONES
text: Estuve en este hotel la primera semana de diciembre, y además de que la calefacción de la habitación no funcionaba, al comprobar mi cuenta, me encuentro que tengo un cargo en mi tarjeta de crédito de 168,17€, con fecha del 19 de diciembre. Ni ese día, que ni siquiera estaba en EEUU, ni durante la semana que pasé en en hotel, realicé ninguna compra, o gasto que justifique dicho cargo. Les he escrito varios correos, pero ni siquiera se han tomado la molestia de contestar. Al menos he leído otra opinión en la que pasaba lo mismo, por lo que les aconsejo que si van a NY, no reserven en este hotel, son unos LADRONES.

title: To many rooms for the facilities. Airports are less packed and better service.
text:
The hotels facilities can obviously not handle the hotel capacity.

Breakfast (if you do not want to adhere to their schedule and be there at 06:30AM) is a catastrophe! People are sitting on floors, long lines at the buffet and once you get there, everything is empty. There is not even water or juice in the lobby. So a "breakfast included"-booking basically comes without a breakfast.

There is two elevators for the whole 14 stories of the hotel. Whenever you need them they are most probably full, once they arrive after a five minute wait. So be sure you can take the stairs!

The staff and management are nice but completely overwhelmed by this and are not at all able to help.

The rooms are solid. We got rooms that are very small with no space to store luggage. Also the only window faces the inside of the building and basically 10 other rooms can look inside your room. However the rooms are pretty new and look nice at first glance. Unfortunately they tend to be a little dirty/dusty around the edges and corners.

This is so far the worst experience that I ever encountered in any Marriott Bonvoy hotel. Can't recommend unfortunately. The rooms themself would qualify for a 3- to 4-star review but again the overall situation is just a mess.

And be sure to mention that you want to get Marriott Bonvoy-points, because they will not ask you for your membership.

title: Excelente
text: Muy buen hotel, excelentes instalaciones. Habitación amplia con cama King size súper cómoda. Con heladera y microondas en la habitación. Baño con todo lo necesario. Buena limpieza. El desayuno excelente, más de lo que uno acostumbra a comer.

title: Modernes Hotel mit toller Lage
text: Das SpringHill Hotel ist modern eingerichtet und in unmittelbarer Nähe der 34 Street Penn (Metro-)Station. Auch der Times Square & das Empire State Building lassen sich problemlos zu Fuß zu erreichen. Unser Zimmer war ebenfalls komfortabel eingerichtet und wir haben uns in den sechs Nächten sehr wohl gefühlt. Etwas nervig war der für die Besucheranzahl zu kleine Frühstücksraum und lediglich zwei zur Verfügung stehende Fahrstühle. Gerade in den Morgenstunden mussten wir regelmäßig 10-15 Minuten auf einen freien Aufzug warten.

title: Fantástico hotel para visitar NY
text:
Hemos estado en familia durante 6 noches alojados en este hotel.
Puntos positivos:
- Buena ubicación
- Buena limpieza
- Agua, café sin coste en recepción
- Habitación no muy grande pero confortable y limpia
- Camas muy cómodas
- Servicio desayuno muy completo y renuevan constantemente los alimentos
- Personal muy amable y atento, tanto en recepción como en el salón comedor
Puntos a mejorar:
- Al ser un hotel muy grande, falta espacio para el desayuno. Sin embargo, tampoco no es un gran problema porque se acaba encontrando mesa
Es un hotel muy recomendable para alojarse en NY

title: Weekend in the City
text: I had requested early check in about a month and a half prior to our stay on Dec 21st. We were only able to get into our room around 3 pm. I understand it was the weekend before Christmas so the hotel was booked and the lobby was overflowing with guests. No issues they were kind enough to hold our bags while we went out to get something to eat. The room was big enough for two people, king bed was comfortable and very clean. Shower was wonderful. The breakfast was plentiful and had many different options. The staff was kind and the location was in walking distance to some great restaurants. Its about a half mile walk to Times Square. I would recommend this hotel to those staying in the city.

title: Great Hotel
text: The hotel is located around many restaurants, stores and train stations. The staff is always very courteous and helpful. Rooms are very neat and clean.  Bathrooms are a little smaller than usual but still are fully equipped with toiletries and fresh towels.

title: Decent
text:
First, be prepared to wait for elevators. Whose idea was it to install only 2 elevators per hotel?
Housekeeping: had to ask more than once for replacement coffee service and new shampoos after a room cleaning. One of those times I went to the front desk myself to ask for replacements, I was told they would send it up and it never arrived.  
One of three elliptical machines in gym is broken. Water in fitness center frequently had no cups. 

Design is nice. Central location. Staff is friendly. Two requests for different shower issues were handled very quickly.

title: Perfect Hotel for our holiday !
text:
Booked this hotel late trying to save some money on accommodation and we was very happy that we decided to opt for this hotel ,Friendly staff and very good options for breakfast .Room was small but we knew this when booked but bed was very comfortable and good shower also !
Only one complaint was sometimes difficult to get a lift this didn’t bother us as could do the stairs but wouldn’t want to be much higher then the 6th floor !

title: Surprised Amzingly
text: IN NY ManHattan area, to get such a big room was surprisingly positive. Ambience, welcoming reception, open space all appreciated.  Only area of improvement was breakfast spcae & some more veggie option at Breakfast needed.

title: Un acierto!!!! 100%
text:
Acabamos de volver de alojarnos en este hotel 5 noches y tengo q decir que es un hotel estupendo en todos los sentidos!!! Está muy cerca de times square, del metro Pen station, del empire state, y de muchas otras zonas turísticas. Como he leído en otros comentarios las habitaciones no son especialmente grandes pero nosotros éramos tres y teníamos espacio suficiente para las dos camas dobles un sofá y el armario, y el baño...en realidad no vas a Nueva York para estar en la habitación, solo la usas para dormir, así q en mi opinión hay espacio más que suficiente. Un detalle q nos ha gustado, es q tienen enchufes USB en la habitación, y eso es muy comodo, y no hemos tenido q usar adaptadores. 
El desayuno está bastante bien, los fines de semana puedes hacer tus propios gofres, y, eso sí, es mejor bajar pronto, para que puedas coger mesa con más facilidad, aunque realmente es bastante ágil. Las camas son de las más cómodas q he probado en un hotel, y os aseguro que soy bastante especial para este tema. 
El personal de recepción son amables, pero tengo que destacar la atención de Harold, quien nos ayudó mucho con el tema de la empresa de traslado, ya que habla español...muy amable por su parte. 
Por lo demás, es un hotel muy nuevo y limpio, bien situado y que nos ha gustado mucho. Lo recomiendo 100%!!!

title: Great hotel with a perfect location
text: Just spent 2 days at this great hotel. The rooms are small, but immaculate and very well designed. The breakfast was wonderful. We loved the location and plan to stay here again soon! We highly recommend this Spring Hills Suites,

title: Must have been a bad day
text: New York City at Christmas time. What could be better? I planned a fun filled holiday weekend with family and friends. I called a month ahead of time to reserve any two rooms adjacent to each other for my loved ones. Marriott said, “No problem”. I get an email a couple days before my arrival asking for any requests. I try to confirm the rooms near each other. Nope. They make it happen and email me confirmation. I arrive to find. Nope. Sorry. You now have to wait an hour and a half for us to find you the second room. I had reservations for dinner and the Rockettes. I was not pleased. We had to rush to dinner and the show. Everyone was cranky after that. They offered me some points back only after I complained in writing. I like the location and the property but service was lacking.

title: Great location
text: In town for the Jimmy V Classic at MSG. Staff was amazing. Front Desk and Bell Staff great with directions and recommendations. Will look to stay again when I'm back. Transportation service was great. Got me to my meeting, waited for me, and got me back to the Hotel. Very much needed during the busy morning traffic!

title: Fantástico hotel
text: Acabamos de volver y ha sido maravilloso, el hotel tiene muy buena ubicación, instalaciones nuevas, el trato al cliente es exquisito, te ayudan muchísimo. El desayuno muy bueno, variado y abundante, de 16.00 a 22.00 h, en el Hall tienes bebidas gratis. En la habitación microondas, nevera, tabla de planchar y plancha. El armario si es escaso, pero bueno, éramos 3 y nos apañamos muy bien. Muy limpio y lo dicho, recepcionistas muy dispuestos y todo el personal en general muy simpático.

title: Excellent staff, but overwhelmed property
text: This hotel does not fit the brand promise - the rooms are not suites and they are super small.  How Marriott distinguishes this product from the Fairfield Inn (which occupies the top floors of the same building) is a mystery. Also, if you're noise sensitive, don't stay on the 36th Street side.  In fact, if you're noise sensitive, stay at the Fairfield on the upper floors facing away from the street.  The public space is way undersized for the number of guests - you've got to fight to get your breakfast, fight for a table to sit to eat that breakfast.  Long wait to speak to a person at the front desk or to answer the phone. Housekeeping is overwhelmed as well - you may or may not get regular housekeeping.  However, several at the front desk have the hospitality gene- including Coleen, Roxanne, and Amanda.  Avoid the others if possible.  On the very positive side, this is a new hotel and the guest rooms are well appointed, beds are comfortable, TVs large, lighting good, etc.

title: First time here
text:
Girls trip, 

First time in New York and the service of this hotel was incredible. The staff really went above and beyond for us nothing was too big an ask for them

Will definitely recommend to others and a second trip for myself

title: Nice hotel, good location
text: The hotel was reasonably priced for the great location. Rooms are not huge, but good sized for NYC. Everything was clean and well maintained. When contacting the front desk, they were quick and responsive to our needs. Breakfast was good. The last day of our stay, one of the elevators broke, making it difficult to get around, but other than that, I'd stay here again.

title: Convenient Location
text:
This is a new property and very well located.  Room is comfortable,  but very small.  The ironing board takes up most of the closet space, and safe is located under closet, so you need to lie on the floor with your own flashlight to use it.  Small bar and lounge not separated from reception area/waiting room, and at Happy Hour most seats are taken by families with huge luggage.  It would be wonderful if they could separate areas and remove bright lights.  Happy Hour 4-7 with good prices, but bar food cannot be purchased until 6 pm.  Nice to meet for cocktail and conversation before dinner res.  Elevators are shared with work
Staff and sometimes one is taken out of service to be used for food service only.  The breakfast is complimentary and very good, a step above.  All in all it is a great value, comfortable and would be great if they improve the few negatives I mentioned.

title: False Advertising
text: A 9' x 15' room with a microwave on a shelf does not make a SpringHill Suites!  This is blatant false advertising.  This hotel should be rebranded as it does not fit the brand profile.  I could not sit in the chair at the so-called desk, as it was wedged in between the so-called desk and a small couch.  In the bathroom, there was nowhere to place a toiletry kit -- I had to leave it on the bed while using it.  The HVAC sounded like a jet engine, and kept going on and off.  The temperature control had two settings -- too cold and too hot.  Avoid this property.

title: First time in New York, hotel perfect
text:
I came to New York expecting our room to be small as apparently that's very common here. The room was small and compact, especially as 4 of us were staying in one room (2 couples) but we managed perfectly. We were only there for 3 nights so just lived from our suitcases. 

The room was modern and clean, the shower room was also spotless. I'm very fussy when it comes to cleanliness and this hotel didn't disappoint. 

The complimentary breakfast that was included with our trip was fantastic considering it was free. It might not please some that you eat from paper plates and plastic cutlery but i guess that's how they stay on top of keeping on top of demand as breakfast was always busy with people coming and going. We didn't struggle with queues at all though and to be honest i don't mind eating from paper plates, it's only a quick breakfast before heading out for the day. Breakfast included English breakfast selection, waffles (only on the one morning, the other 2 mornings the waffle machine disappeared), a selection of fruit, cereals, yogurts, toast machines, drink machines... What more could you need!

I've read a review since coming home about the heating in the rooms being noisy - on my first night when my sister in law put the heating i was like "are we sleeping with that on!?" - but once i got into bed and got used to it it didn't affect me at all during our stay. 

The location is perfect - i'd definitely stay here again and have recommended the hotel to my Sister who would like to come to New York one day.

title: Sin calefacción en la habitación, con temperaturas bajo 0°
text: Mi opinión sobre el hotel no puede ser peor, en los 7 días que he pasado en el hotel la calefacción de mi habitación no ha funcionado correctamente. Tras funcionar durante unas horas, está se apagaba y no había forma de encenderla. Llamaba al tecnico, este la encendía, se volvía a apagar al cabo de unas horas, y otra vez a empezar. Esto ha se ha producido cuando en NY las temperaturas durante estos siete días en ningún momento han superado los 0C. La solución que me propusieron el 4° día, era cambiar de habitación, eso sí, perdiendo toda una mañana de mis vacaciones, ya que además se tener que hacer las maletas, tenía que esperar durante hasta las más tarde de las 12 a que me dieran la nueva habitación. Por todo ello NO recomiendo elegir este hotel cuando sea necesaria la calefacción o el AC.Má

title: Poorly thought-through property w/tiny rooms and bathrooms....
text:
We have gold status at Marriott hotels—but this place stuck us in what looked like one of the smallest rooms on the 16th floor where we grew old just waiting for the elevators.   The room was clean—and the bed was okay, but the air handling system boomed on and off all night long.  There is a tiny armoire closet—but absolutely no shelf-space. Our bathroom was slightly larger than a phone booth (remember those?) with the toilet facing the bed.  
We were there for three nights—and the trash that was on the hall-floor outside our door the first night we arrived was still there when we checked out.
Someone who strutted around in the lobby for about five minutes looking like a manager picked up a stray cup and then disappeared. 
Gratis coffee in the lobby is a nice touch—but only if there is actually coffee in the pot.  The concierge told us she wasn't authorized to notify anyone that it was empty—that was the job of the desk clerks...but the desk clerks had long lines of people to check in and out. 
The breakfast buffet was above standard, in a nice room that the staff worked hard to keep clean and picked up, and well-managed.  
Still, Marriott has some real work to do if this property is to be palpable.  Better general management might be a good place to start.
If you are traveling solo and not in a big rush, this hotel is okay and close to The Javits' Center. Beyond that, meh.

title: December in New York
text: Excellent location, quiet room , wonderful bed and great high definition television- within walking distance to Penn station- large eating area for breakfast included. Staff was very helpful and courteous.

title: Appena sufficiente
text:
Ho soggiornato in questo hotel 1 settimana con 2 amiche, la camera era carina e pulita ma piccolissima per 3 persone ,c’era un armadietto minuscolo dove a malapena stava un piumino quindi avevamo le valigie per terra e sopra la scrivania di fronte ai letti. La colazione punto dolente dell’hotel:va bene che fosse compresa però era un disastro, i prodotti come croissant e pane in cassetta cattivissimi marmellate idem disordine ovunque bidoni della spazzatura ovunque che venivano svuotati quando ormai erano  stracolmi da maleducatissimi inservienti che usavano guanti di protezione sia per togliere le brioche dal sacchettone di plastica dove erano contenute sia per svuotare i sacchi della spazzatura. I tavoli per la colazione insufficienti per l’afflusso di persone e perennemente sporchi e da sbarazzare. Quindi non date la colazione compresa nel prezzo se questo è il risultato.  Un’altra cosa inconcepibile era lo stazionamento di cassoni di biancheria a volte sporca a volte lavata davanti all’hotel e immondizia a giorni alterni... 
Una cosa positiva era la vicinanza della subway.

title: Great value, great location
text: We came for a college hockey game at MSG and a Broadway show.  The location was great for both.  The staff was very friendly, even when the lobby was crazy busy, and they stored our luggage until our room was ready.  Our room was small, not much view, but fine (big TV, good WiFi, and lots of outlets -- yeay!).  The hot buffet breakfast food was standard but plenty of it.  The lobby was modest, but at night, the lobby coffee was still hot --- yeay again!  It's not a fancy place, but it had everything we wanted, and [with our senior discount] a fantastic value.

title: Excelente estancia, pero mucho cuidado con los cargos extra
text: Nos hemos alojado en este hotel con motivo de nuestras vacaciones. Es la octava vez consecutiva que vamos a Nueva York porque nos entusiasma la ciudad, y de hoteles americanos entendemos bastante debido a nuestra experiencia. En primer lugar hay que entender que estamos en Nueva York y por ende, las habitaciones son pequeñas. He leído opiniones negativas de este hotel alegando lo reducido que es el espacio y he entendido dichas opiniones cuando he visto la tipología de huésped que se alojaba. Entiendo que el hotel acaba de abrir y lo están promocionando a base de grupos numerosos de turistas, los cuales han estado muy poquito en tierras americanas. Vamos a ver, si estamos habituados a ir de "excursión" a Benidorm, Tenerife y similares, donde por el mismo precio o incluso menos, nos alojamos en habitaciones que tienen su salón, dormitorio, terraza, etc, pues claro, venimos a Nueva York y queremos una suite presidencial en el Plaza, pero no señores, estamos en Nueva York, y eso se paga. Dicho esto y basándome en mi experiencia tras haber pasado por esta ciudad ocho veces, además de por Washington, Philadelphia, Chicago, Delaware, Boston y New Hampsire, la habitación del Springhill Suites es grande, y por el precio que tiene, lo es aún más. Hemos estado muy a gusto, la limpieza, la atención, el desayuno, la calefacción (que les aseguro que no es ruidosa, y lo digo por experiencia), el gimnasio, la lavandería, la recogida de paquetes en recepción, y en general todo, ha sido sobresaliente, y nunca he tenido esta experiencia en un hotel de Nueva York. Ni un solo problema durante toda la estancia....y cuando todo parecía ser perfecto, en el último minuto (literalmente), al hacer el check out, lo arruinan todo, intentando cobrar cuatro míseros dólares por una supuesta conexión a la red wifi de alta velocidad. En mi caso se han escudado en que un día me he conectado, y hay que decir que el acceso a la red es complejo, enrevesado más bien, y para alguien que no esté acostumbrado, difícil, porque intentas entrar y no lo consigues hasta que terminas dando vete a saber tú dónde y accedes, ¿se puede hacer de otra forma? Por supuesto, cambiando la forma de acceder, pero eso no les interesa, por supuesto....había leído una opinión que advertía de la cautela que había que tener con los cargos extra, y estoy en la obligación de decir que es totalmente cierto, y me parece un abuso que se intente sacar dinero de confusiones y malos entendidos. Tras mucho protestar y porque caía por su propio peso, nos "quitaron" el cargo, pero precisamente por haberme hecho pasar ése último minuto, y para evitar que futuros huéspedes lo tengan que pasar, aviso de ello aquí. Por lo demás, el hotel es de diez, pero lo de los cargos encubiertos....

title: overnight in NYC
text: walking distance to Penn Station. Great hotel. Clean, nice staff. Rooms were TINY, but well worth the price! Full complimentary breakfast was amazing. We had such a nice stay and we will definitely book this hotel again.

title: Beware of this hotel !
text:
Where do I start ?
I’ve stayed at 29 different Marriott hotels this year. I booked SPRINGHILL Studio, 2 queen with Terrace for 2 nights. The sole reason I booked this hotel was for the terrace. 
1. Upon check-in my loyalty was acknowledged :-) . 
2. Post checkin I stopped at the refreshment stand to grab some water but the water station was empty.
3. Upon arrival to the elevator I had a 27 minute way and approximately 50 people waiting for the elevator (photo attached).
4. Upon arrival to my room I noticed they put me at FAIRFIELD not SpringHill as I had originally booked. I also noticed no terrace (the sole reason I booked this hotel at the HIGHER COST).
5. Human blood stains found on bed #1 photos attached .
6. Old food found in the fridge (photos attached). 
7. The room was saturated in a chemical smell (not good for an individual as myself who is sensitive/carries 3 epi pens with me)
8. sleep was nearly impossibly as you could hear every person leaving/entering the elevator, room doors slamming, some noise above that sounded like a cannon going off every 12 minutes throughout the night . 
9. No matter what I changed the thermostat to, the heat did not waiver in temperature(photo attached). I set the thermostat to 65 and the room NEVER got below 78. Due to the extreme heat in the room I had to jeopardize my privacy and safety by keeping my hotel room door propped open with a trash can. 
10. 5:05am I was awoken by doors slamming/people showering . PERFECT. Who needs sleep right ? 
11. 6am I proceeded downstairs for coffee/ talk with hotel management. 16 minutes to get to the lobby via elevator due to the mass influx of people. 
12. 620 arrive to front doors of the breakfast room (that opens at 630am). I politely poke my head in & ask the wait staff where might I be able to obtain a cup of coffee. I was then scorned at by the staff screaming at me “we are not open yet”. 
13. 625am I speak with the hotel front desk. I inquire into why I was placed into Fairfield when I had booked SpringHill 2 weeks prior. The Ladie stated it was because there rooms are full. As a gold member I booked my hotel 2 weeks in advance and did  Mobile checkin 24hours prior to my arrival. Isn’t this something you should inform your guests on? Furthermore, I booked AND PAID MORE FOR a room with a terrace, but I didn’t receive such; in fact, I didn’t even get the correct hotel I booked with. The Ladie stated she would speak with the hotel manager. I asked her to please inform the manager that my room also has a fridge full of old moldy food/blood on bed sheets. Few minutes later she returned in which she stated the manager would be calling booking.com to see what happened . Well, I didn’t book on booking.com. All she could offer me was 10,000 points on Marriott account. To me, this was an insult. I then asked if they have terrace rooms in which she replied “no”. I booked a suite with a terrace at a higher cost , but no rooms at said hotel have a terrace? - this is false advertising and representation!!! No refund for the higher cost of my non existent “terrace room” was provided or offered . Switching rooms also unavailable . The front desk ladie could offer me no more. I then asked her “well could I AT THE VERY LEAST get my moldy fridge cleaned and the BLOOD off my bed?” In which she stated, “yes I will send someone up right away”. I kindly thanked her. 
14. 645am breakfast has a Good selection of food. Go early. Already about 100 people in breakfast area (photos attached) . 
15. After breakfast proceeded to my room . 24 minutes to get up to my floor . Finally got on an elevator and I was scrunched in between about 50 people. By the time I made it to my floor (25) I had 2 people cough in my face, 1 man pressed up directly on top of my buttocks, and 3 different individuals hair in my coffee . So much for my morning coffee I was so desperate for. 
16. 10am, I have now cleaned the fridge myself but still have human blood on my bed . No housekeeping as of yet .
17. 4:30pm housekeeping knocks on my door asking if I need anything. I explain my requests put in at 6am. Housekeeper was not knowledgeable of this & apologized . Housekeeper stated the new linens are downstairs and some one will bring them right up. She also stated she informed the manager and I should expect a call from the manager within 15 minutes . I kindly thanked her .
18. 4:45pm new housekeeper shows up . Hands me a new set of linen/blankets & walks away. I guess the $500 I paid for my “terrace” room includes me making my own bed and removing blood stained sheets myself ?! Good thing I have medical gloves with me . 
19. Bartender downstairs was INCREDIBLE , I thank you !
20. Next morning I check out. Never heard from a manager . 
21. This is my first and last time staying at a Fairfield Inn. 
22. I’ve stayed at 29 different Marriott locations this year, I travel weekly for business , and I always attempt to book a Marriott before any other hotel. This stay has now made me re-consider my loyalty to this company !

title: ペンステーションから2ブロックの便利な立地居心地のいい部屋
text:
ニューワークとJFKどちらの空港へのゲートウェーになるペンステーションへ2ブロックというのは非常に便利な立地です。

NYのホテルはベッドが事実上の唯一の家具場所も多いですが、ここのお気に入りはコンパクトながらもテーブルと一体となったソファがある事。このおかげで居心地が非常に良く感じました。

またベッドも非常に寝心地が良く、また泊まりたいと思うホテルでした。難点は朝食時のスペースが混み合っていることくらいですかね。

title: Amazing hotel
text: Great hotel in a great location in NYC. The associates were very friendly and helpful and the rooms/property were spotless!  Great breakfast assortment in the morning and a nice happy hour in the evening.

title: Great location and amenities
text: I was pleasantly surprised by my stay at this hotel. It is a newer hotel, so it has the amenities (keyed elevator access, room safe, USD inputs by bed) a business traveler expects. The breakfast selection is extensive and the seating area is well thought out. Check in was a breeze and the staff was very pleasant. The hotel is a block away from subway lines. I'll stay here again.

title: Très bonne situation et petit déjeuner
text:
L'hotel et très bien situé pas très loin de Times Square. Nous sommes partis en fammille avec deux enfants et l'espace dans la chambre était suffisant. Le petit-dejeuner est vraiment un plus bien qu'à partir d'une certaine heure, il faut attendre pour avoir une place assise.
Notre chambre était nettoyée chaque jour. Un hôtel à conseiller pour un séjour à NY

title: Great location, clean & modern
text: Great location. Modern, tasteful decor. Everything appeared to be in brand new condition.  Rooms were clean.  Breakfast is included and it has a wide variety of food to choose from. There were no issues encountered.

title: Great Place
text: Stayed here for the first time...stayed three nights.  The room was clean, updated, and overall very acceptable.  It's a smaller room but then that is often the case with NY!  It is a newly updated hotel, however, and has nice accommodations.  Stays include a free breakfast that doesn't disappoint since it offers many choices.  There is also a bar on site and a very comfortable atmosphere.

title: Not Springhill.   Rooms and housekeeping need improvement.  Great location & service
text:
Marriott regulars should know that this is NOT CONSISTENT with Springhill Suites.   The rooms are not suites and are certainly not like any other Springhill.  You get an email heads up on this a few days before arrival (usually too late to change at that point).  The public areas are very nice.  Service was courteyous and helpful.   Great modern gym.  Good fast internet.   My room was very quiet, which I really like.  Good breakfast.

The rooms are TINY, which is typical for NY but not what a Springhill Suites customer would reasonably expect.   As a solo business traveler I was ok with this.  If I had a family, it would have been a disaster.    The carpet felt dirty and had dark mystery stains.  So did the fabric chair.  Furniture was nicked in places so looked dated.  Desk was occupied by a cheap microwave.

Housekeeping made mistakes each day.  One day they did not replace the cups.  The next, they did not replace the coffee packets.  Every day they did did not clean the coffee maker.

Elevators take a while, which is not atypical in NYC.   The location is excelllent for the Javits and Penn Station.  Not too far from TS if that's your thing.

I might stay again if it's cheap, but I've got other hotels in similar price categories that I like better such as the Fairfield Inn near the bus terminal.  It's about the same as the DT across the street but better service and worse rooms.

title: Good hotel with a few glitches
text: We were in NYC pre-cruise Columbus Day weekend.  The hotel is new and trendy, but the rooms are just a little bigger than a cruise ship cabin.  It was fine for two nights, but to stay for any amount of time would have been cramped.  The safe is on the floor of the tiny closet, you have to literally get on your hands and knees to use it, very awkward.  We were a few doors down from the elevator, and I heard it ding all night long.  The HVAC system was also pretty noisy for light sleepers, but the bed/pillows were nice and comfy.  Staff was young and could have used a little more customer service training.  Breakfast was good and well stocked and staffed, a nice bonus.  We usually stay closer to Grand Central Station, but the rates for the holiday weekend were pretty high.  This hotel is in the garment district, easy to get around but a little gritty.  We never felt unsafe, but there were homeless people sleeping on the streets. Was it a bad hotel?  No, not at all.  But I don't think I'd stay there again, just based on room size and location.

title: Hotel propre calme très bien situé
text:
Chambre très propre, silencieuse, ce qui a mon avis est rare à New York. Un peu petite toutefois (nous étions 4 et avions pris en chambre avec deux lits)
Il y a un micro onde et un frigo, ce qui peut être bien pratique pour un diner rapide dans la chambre. La salle de petit dej est prise d'assaut et il faut attendre parfois un peu pour pouvoir s'y installer (mais nous étions 4) 
Le personnel était très très agréable, souriant et accueillant. 
Je recommande vraiment cet hotel, nous y avons passé un très bon séjour.

title: Stay away unless you want to be robbed by the hotel.
text:
Stay as far away as possible from this establishment unless you want to be robbed! 

I made the reservation through booking.com on 23rd June 2019 for our 2 night stay on 25th October and 26th October. I picked did the pre-payment option and they charged the card on 25th June 2019. Everything looks fine until the night before we checked in. I called ahead the day before our check-in date to make sure things were good to go and they told me they couldn't find our reservation and has not charged our card yet.. Admittedly, it has been a couple of months between june and october so i don't remember if they had charge my card. I had told them it was a prepayment option we picked and should have been charged by now. They went ahead and charged the card again. (I should have realized the red flag. How do they have the card information if they don't have my reservation given that it was my first time in the establishment.) 

2nd Red Flag, they gave us a smaller room than the one we had reserved yet they had the audacity to charged me for the price of the bigger room. I had to go down to tell them at the lobby that is not the one we reserved.

Fast forward to today, I had checked my credit card statement after my trip in new york to find out I had been double charged one in june and one when i checked in. I try to give them the benefit of the doubt and called the hotel to tell them they had double charged me. Basically, front desk told me they weren't able to help and transferred me to accounting... and its nothing but always voicemail. So they basically robbed me blind for my stay here.

*DO NOT STAY HERE EVER*

title: Decent hotel but BAD customer service!
text:
We were on business to New York staying at SpringHill Suites for 6 nights. As titanium member, we requested for an upgrade upon check-in on a Thursday. The staff told us that the hotel was full and told us to come back the next day as most people left on the weekend.

So my husband did go back the next day. Again, we were told that it's full and was told to come back on Saturday. We totally understand that upgrade is not guaranteed and is based on availability. But we knew for sure that the hotel was far from full as half of the breakfast area was closed off in the weekend. At this point, we didn't even care about getting upgrade as it's too much work to pack things up to move to another room. All we wanted was to test the front desk and see how far they can lie to their customers. Lo and behold, we were told to go back on Sunday. We found it absolutely hilarious at this point. 

This hotel is actually not bad for its location and decor but really lacks in customer service. We are proven loyal Marriott customers but don't feel that the hotel even tried the slightest to reciprocate our loyalty. We'll definitely not return to this hotel as there are other good options around the area.

title: úžasný pobyt ve skvělé lokalitě
text:
Hotel byl naprosto fantastický, ve skvělé lokalitě, v blízkosti metra a známých budov/památek. Personál byl velice milý a ochotný a se vším poradil. Kafe/čaj/voda k dispozici celý den. Wifi fungovala skvěle. K snídani podávali vajíčka, šunku/sýr, bagel, marmeládu, vafle atd. Dalo se v pohodě vybrat.
Pokoje útulné, čisté, pohodlné postele. Plus za usb připojení. Denně úklid.

Jediné co by se dalo vylepšit je omezit plastové příbory u snídaně.

title: I would not recommend a stay here
text:
Hmm where do I start. It's not the worst hotel I have ever stayed in but definitely in the low end. If you have very low expectations to your hotel you will probably be fine hence the 2 stars.

A bit about the hotel itself. It says "new", but it's actually just renovated which you can clearly tell on the inside. Rooms are VERY small, some of them can barely fit the king size bed. Most bathrooms have a sliding door facing the bed which is a bit uncomfortable. The rooms have a ventilation system besides the AC unit which is quite noisy and cannot be turned off. If you are on the top floor it will sound like a hurricane just outside your door (I brought one of the front desk guys up there and he was even shocked).
Elevators are a chapter for themselves, they are very slow and in some rooms you will hear them operate with banging and buzzing sounds. 
Breakfast is free and decent but basically quantity over quality. Staff are friendly but don't seem to have the power to properly handle and compensate issues. 

But let's dig into why it was an unpleasant experience for me. I stayed for 5 nights and basically spent the first 24 hours switching rooms until I found one that was tolerable. They kept saying that they were fully booked but somehow found rooms once I insisted. As compensation for my trouble I was given a free drink at the bar which turned out to be only valid for some pre-made punch. Sigh.

In summary, the hotel has a good location but is severely lacking in quality. And the  high price is in no way justifiable. I would not recommend a stay in this hotel.

title: Great stay
text: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel very much. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the hotel is very accommodating (I asked for a room on a high floor and away from the elevators, which I got). The rooms are comfortable and clean but fairly small but were big enough for two and three suitcases (when you put suitcases on the furniture, but hey, you're not going to New York to sit in your room). Breakfast is fine, we usually got down at around 8:30 - 8:40 and, while busy, we always had room to sit and there was plenty of food (hotel does warn that 8:30 - 10:00 is busiest period). The hotel is ideally located near Times Square and near Penn Station and the subway, so very easy to get around the city.

title: Great place and good location
text: Enjoyed our stay here.  Check in was very fast.  Stayed in a room with 2 queen beds.  The hotel is very modern.  Bathroom was decent size for NYC.  There were plenty of outlets to plug in devices.  There is a small fridge, safe, and even a small couch area.  Everything seemed pretty new.  We were far from the elevators and it was quiet.  The hotel has a surprising large hotel lobby and the seating area for the including breakfast was big enough to find a spot each morning even around the 8 am busy period.  The breakfast itself was fine.  Internet worked well.  I would stay here around!

title: Nice Hotel but TINY rooms- not for a family!
text: Beautiful exterior and nicely done, updated and pretty lobby. Rooms have hard floors (no carpet), new and modern. Bathroom has walk in shower but small. The entire room is just really really small. Fine for 1-2 people but wouldn’t recommend for a family of 4. Close quarters!  HVAC was also loud and woke us up a few times through the night. Would stay here again if I’m in the area but probably only if I’m by myself for a business trip.

title: BEWARE this place cancels your accomodation so your stranded.
text:
Our travel agent booked and paid for our accomodation and we received a confirmation printout from Springhill NY Times Square for 5 nights on 23 Sep 2019. Turning up at 11.30pm with 2 children and having had no dinner the manager on duty said there was no room for us. They cancelled our booking. She lied by saying they called our travel agent on the Friday yet the booking was made on the Saturday. She didnt offer to help us find accomodation. She didnt offer us food or water for the kids. She was prepared for a tourist family from Australia to walk the New York streets. Such a shameful act.
She also refused to speak to our travel agent to help sort it out.
Never never trust Springhill Suites NYC Times Square.

title: Loved everything about this hotel
text: The girls who checked us in were so friendly. The room was immaculate and you can’t beat the location. I’ve been wanting to check out Hudson yards and the high line and it was just a few blocks away and a pleasant walk to Chelsea and Meatpacking and in the other direction a quick walk to all the Broadway shows/Central Park, not to mention PENN Station on 34th. They have a wonderful complimentary breakfast and leave an amazing little brownie in your room that was to die for. I really can’t wait to go back everything about the SpringHill Suites on 36th Ave was PERFECT.  Really CLEAN rooms too.

title: Great Stay at a Convenient Location
text: Awesome weekend spent at the SpringHill Suites. Clean, convenient and super friendly staff. Ian was extremely friendly upon check-in. Breakfast opens early & stays open until 11am. Gym facilities were actually in great shape too! It's a convenient location from all mass transit options & from Penn Station. (Oh - and Paul Mitchell products!!) Will definitely be back.

title: AVOID!  A mess: cramped, loud, cleaners banging doors constantly all day long, no  facilities.
text:
You will not rest here, which was the most important aspect for me. 

Yes, the location is convenient for the Javits center and Penn Station. There is free decent breakfast by cheap hotel standards and a little fitness room.   And a pretty crappy bar. That's where the goodness ends.

The place is so over-crowded with tiny common areas that make you step over people left and right.  Lines are long, staff is short. The cleaning staff spent the entire day BANGING DOORS every 10 seconds (as they cleaned rooms and went in and out they just let doors slam).  You can easily hear people in the halls from your room. My room looked straight at a wall.  Coffee maker but no tea and just powdered creamer.  They shut off the main entrance for hours in the morning as 

Small rooms which is fine in NYC but then why call it "Suites"?   Only thing resembling a suite was a microwave. 

Bed was OK.

Basically you find yourself wanting to get out of the hotel as soon as possible as its designed to completely stress you out and feels like an upgraded prison cell with nowhere to escape anywhere else in the hotel.  

Oh, and it's $500 a night.

If you're fine with that and just want Marriot points, stay here.  But in my 20+ years with Marriot this was one of the worst.  Its basically just so cramped eveyrwhere that it puts the guests and the staff in an unhappy situation.

title: Great Location
text:
The location is great. Room is big enough for two people. Room and bathroom were very cleaned and the carpet still looks new.  

Walls are very thin and you can hear everything so I would ask for a corner room and away from the elevator. The AC in our room was very loud that we had to do a room change. Ask for a room with a couch that one was bigger than the one we changed to even though it was the same type of room.

title: Loved it
text:
great stay, i highly recommend this hotel! i've given it four stars just due some things that i felt could be fixed(i've talked to the manager about this already). the hotel is large and rooms are smaller than other cities, but it's NYC thats totally expected. if you are looking for a huge room this is not that place for you, sorry.  location is everything in NYC and this hotel meets all expectations on location. if you arent a fan of the subway(me) then this property will work for you. everything you need is walking distance, everything you want to see is walking distance, its great!  Staff was great from the moment i checked in at 11pm to when i left 3 days later. breakfast was standard, very fresh too.

overall, i'd stay there again.

title: Overall, a good experience, but stay away from the bar!
text: We just got back from a weekend in NYC. We stayed in a room with 2 queen beds on the 12th floor. The room was tiny, but comfortable and clean. The front desk personnell were very nice, and they even stored our luggage for us since the room was so small. The breakfast buffet is amazing, and has everything you could want for breakfast. The only complaint we have is the bar. We went to the bar multiple times during our stay, and it was never busy. At most, we saw a dozen people sitting in that area having drinks. Lucky them!  The bartenders would ignore us every time we went to the bar. It was the strangest thing. On our last night, we called down to the front desk and asked when the bar closed. It wasn't that time yet, so my friend ran down to get a drink to bring back to the room. The bartender would not sell her a drink, even though the front desk said they were open. So, good hotel, horrible bar.

title: A VERY UNCOMFORTABLE STAY
text:
It is important to know that Marriott's  SPRINGHILL SUITES brand is marketed as an all suite property throught the U.S.   I am very familiar with the brand asd have stayed at 12 diffeent properties of this brand around the U.S.

(Below is a copy of an email sent to a member of the hotel's management team after my stay)

The following letter will serve as my review.

Dear Erin,
Forgive me for I must be blunt.

I do not know if this email is standard to all guests or specifically to me as a Lifetime Titanium Elite.

In any event my stay at the hotel was one of the most uncomfortable I have experienced in memory.  

At the outset, let me say the only "saving grace" at the property(ies') was the staff - they were pleasant, helpful and kept you at ease at all times.

SpringHill is a great brand - one of my favorites (of the Marriott offerings).  Placing this label on your property is an insult to the brand.  Not only an insult, but could be construed to be misleading and an injustice to those expecting even a slight resemblance to the standard SpringHill property.

Furthermore, to combine this brand with a brand which is recognized as a lower level than SH is further evidence of misleading the public expecting a SH experience.  (This by both brands offering the same product under the same roof).

My room (two beds) was impossible to negotiate moving from the bed to the bathroom without hitting walls and banging your legs on the base of the beds.  One bed was impossible to get to without damage to a person's body.  The ultimate "crime" was the proximity of the bathroom to the beds made you feel you were sleeping in the bathroom.

I don't think it necessary to describe any further.  As a member of the property's management team no one is more familiar with the problems.

In the least the SH brand name should be removed from the property as it damages Marriott's image as is DEFINITELY misleading.

I ask your forgiveness in advance as I feel obligated to advise fellow Titanium  Elite members on  sites where I am a member.

I am hopeful that some good will come from this communication so future guests one day will not be disappointed.

title: Be cautious on deposits and fees
text: When I booked into the hotel earlier this September I was told I would have to pay an incidental deposit this didn't bother me as I know it to be procedure for hotels. I paid for this on a different card to the card that made the booking due to errors with my original card working stateside. The lady at the check in and no issue. All was going well, however during my stay I notice a $30 charge taken from my account under the hotel's name. Knowing I had not used any room service I was curious as to what this charge was for so I asked the staff at the main reception who weren't very happy to help with my query. They approached me like I was an idiot for not knowing the charge and the female staff member had an attitude who to me traveling alone for the first time I thought this was unprofessional and rude. They then said this additional charge 2 days after booking in was state tax . However this seemed odd I would be charged state tax half way through my stay and that it was no explained or mentioned to me whilst checking in. Having felt like I was annoying them I walked away unimpressed. A week after checking out I noticed I hadn't had my $60 deposit returned. I contacted the hotel and was told to forward certain details and they would investigate. I am still yet to hear back from them and it had been 10 since I checked out of this hotel and was told within two days my deposit was returned. I feel as though noone wants to help me out with chasing where my money has gone. The room was left how I found it and I like everyone else have bills to pay and every penny helps with doing so. I am disappointed I am being treated as though the company doesn't not care. I stayed at a hotel from the same company but in Dallas and had no issues. Unfortunately I can't recommend this hotel due to the way they respond to financial concerns.

title: PAY A LITTLE MORE AND STAY AT ANOTHER HOTEL.
text:
When planning a trip to NYC, its a dream come true for many people. It's a one in a lifetime trip and the hotel can make or break such a trip, so picking the right hotel is very important. My suggestion for anyone reading this, is to spend a few dollars more and stay at another hotel.  Don't gamble with your dream trip by staying here because it just might not be worth it.

HISTORY:  I booked 3 rooms for 4 nights prior to this hotel opening.

Because we are limited to how much we can write here I will just provide readers with a list of issues we ran in too during our stay.  
- asked for early check in for one of the 3 rooms. Did not happen

- Toilet in one room had to be plunged out multiple times each day

- Rooms were never made up while we were out for the day - had to call when we returned late afternoon and then sit in lobby while they were made up

- Breakfast was a disaster each morning. Multiple stations running out of food and one morning no milk for the rest of the morning.  Crowded. Tables not cleaned. Staff having to cut lines in order to replenish food. Poor design

- Slow elevators.  Hotel is actually 2 hotels, one on top of the other. This hotel occupied bottom 14 floors and other hotel floor 15 and up.  2 elevators per hotel except top hotel walked down to floor 14 to take elevators as there elevators also slow.

- I wrote e-mail while staying there about issues. - no reply

I wrote to Marriott to complain and they forward to hotel my issues. No reply

Why chance it?

title: Brand new, great location, beautiful complimentary breakfast buffet
text: This dual branded Springhill and Fairfield really has it all for corporate travelers AND families.   Rooms are small, but that's just NYC - I had the quietest room I have ever stayed in in the city!   Great complimentary breakfast - full hot with lots of options!   Huge breakfast room and lobby.  GREAT value and staff was wonderful!

title: Good Value in an Expensive City
text: The location is great – just a few blocks from Penn Station so it is very easy to go just about anywhere in New York or beyond. There are also many restaurants and other shops nearby. The facilities are pretty good and what you'd expect from a mid-range type of hotel chain. We had no problem getting a good rest. Breakfast is simple and nothing spectacular, but it's included. The price is significantly more expensive than mid-range hotels in other smaller cities, but considering how expensive hotels are in NYC in general, this hotel provides a really good value. The only annoyance we had was that it took too long to go up and down the elevator between the ground floor and our room's floor – it was always a good 10 minutes or so including waiting for the elevator and then the ride itself.

title: nice and new hotel, services to be improved
text: The hotel is new and clean. The room is much better than the NY city standard for this category. Good position, few minutes from Penn station subway, walking distance from several attractions in midtown. Breakfast service is very chaotic and not adequate for the number of guests. The reception staff is very nice but unfortunately, for the most part, very unprepared, only one receptionist was able to help us and to give an indication regarding how to reach the airport with public transportation.

title: great room for the price! great staff!
text: i have nothing negative to say so let me address some of the complaints other reviewers had. the rooms are kind of small but if you looked at the pictures, you’d know what to expect! for me and my buddy staying only 2 nights, and for less than 150 a night, it was a perfect size. it was in the 90s out when we were there 2 weeks ago, but the a/c was so good i needed the comforter on at night. the staff were great! Ivana, in particular, really helped us out by letting us check in early and upgrading us to a room with a bigger bed. i would definitely stay here again.

title: Mai più in un loro hotel
text:
Abbiamo prenotato 2 camere in questo hotel vedendo il buon giudizio degli utenti. Quando veniamo a New York utilizziamo di solito la catena Hilton Garden/double Three, ma questa volta ci siamo fatti convincere da link pubblicitari durante la ricerca.
L'hotel si trova in una posizione comunque buona ed è recente.  Il personale cordiale come tutti gli americani ma impreparato, improvvisato, non professionale.
Le nostre camere queen erano talmente piccole che, senza armadio, non c'era posto neanche per una valigia. Il rotolo della carta igienica appoggiato su wc, senza appiggi, e salviette appoggiate senza possibilità di appenderle. Dietro rimostranze ci hanno dato 2 camere con letto king dove un mini armadio conteneva nulla e le valigie appena si potevano aprire.
La colazione dalle 8.30 è una guerra per trovare pisto e cibo, continuamente mancante, per incapacità organizzativa.
La stanza si dimenticavano di pulirla e la sera, dopo aver appurato ciò e chiesto teli x doccia, abbiamo dovuto attendere 40 minuti e fare 4 telefonate per ottenerli.
Se avete problemi con le scale, non prenotate qui...l'ascensore è praticamente inutilizzabile nelle ore della colazione,  salvo attendere 15 minuti per scendere e 15 per salire.
Il prezzo trovato era in linea con altri hotel della zona pertanto nulla giustifica tutto ciò. 
La camera veniva pulita frettolosamente, abbiamo lasciato a terra un'etichetta di un vestito acquistato ed è rimasta a terra per 5 giorni. Lo specchio del bagno mai pulito in 5 giorni. Voto 1 per tutto questo contestualizzando prezzo e nome catena. Chiaro che non é una bettola o sporco o schifoso, ma questi disservizi in nessun altro hotel in 30 di giramondo li ho mai incontrati.

title: Nice , clean, new hotel
text: Really enjoyed our stay here. The guy who checked us in was very nice and it was quick. Liked our room. It had a refrigerator and microwave. A lot of the reviews complained about a/c not working...luckily ours kept the room cold. Free breakfast was nice, but it was so crowded...people were eating in the lobby. There is a laundry room downstairs which came in handy. Washed clothes before heading on our cruise.

title: Small room, photos are deceiving!
text:
I travel to NYC every month for work and usually stay at another hotel, but the rates there were prohibitive, so I was happy to see this new hotel in Midtown.  SpringHill Suites shares a lobby and check-in area with the also new Fairfield Inn and Suites.  T

PROS: The lobby is beautiful, so, after a long day of working, I was looking forward to getting to my room (king bed) and this was a good start.  The front desk staff is great and very friendly.  The bathroom has a walk-in shower with a shelf that holds everything (one of pet peeves is a shower shelf that only holds a bar of soap and tiny shampoo and conditioners).

CONS: Well, the room was small and dark.  My room did not face the street but rather faced an inside air shaft, so even in the morning, I had to turn on all the lights because it was too dark.  The bed stands are tiny; one only had enough room for the phone and the other for the alarm clock, so I had to put the phone on the floor to have room for my CPAP.  There is barely enough room to walk around the bed.  The TV is huge, but you can't adjust it to watch it from the sofa.  The bathroom is small, but there is a wall-mounted shelf that holds your products.   The breakfast is your typical hotel free buffet, but the breakfast area isn't big enough to hold everyone from both hotels.

title: Good things come in small packages
text:
Great location, great service, clean comfy room.
From the moment i spoke with Colleen, Director of Front office, i knew i was at the right place. SO helpful, and great energy.
Answered my questions, and took the time to care. The rooms are not big, but if Clean, comfy, GREAT location, and GREAT service are for you, Springhill is for you.

title: Perfect Weekend Away
text: The hotel is very nice, updated and clean. The breakfast is OUTSTANDING. I have never seen a free breakfast buffet as nice as this one. Yes, the hotel room is small, but it's perfect. We were only there to sleep, not to hang out in the room. This hotel is an excellent value for a trip to NYC.

title: Great Clean Hotel in Good Location
text: This hotel is centrally located in Manhattan, close to the Empire State Bldg, Times Square, Broadway shows, etc.  The rooms were a good size, with two beds, small couch, small table, and closet.  Bathroom was ample size in square footage but had a small sink area.  Hotel was clean and beds were comfortable.  Breakfast was average, with hot and cold options available.  Overall hotel stay was very pleasant for a quick weekend trip, would stay again.

title: Good Location; Small Room but Well Appointed; Courteous Staff; Good Breakfast
text:
We just returned from a 3-night stay at this hotel and we had a great time! There were 4 of us - mom + 3 teenagers.  I had some concerns going in after reading the reviews that mentioned that the rooms were very, very small and that the air conditioning was faulty.   Although I will agree that the room was small, I was very pleased that our room had 2 queen-sized beds (unusual for NY where many rooms had full-sized beds) and that the design of the room made good use of the available space.  If you have ever traveled in Europe, the room size is comparable to many of the European hotels that I have stayed in ..not much extra room aside from the beds.  That said, there was a small closet and a small desk.  We ended up using both to the hilt to unpack and store our things - I ended commandeering the ironing board which I put alongside one of the beds to put one of our suitcases on.  Another was placed on the small desk.  I unpacked and used the closet, which really left only one suitcase that was still "floating" in the room, so we were fine overall.

One nice feature were the generous outlets in the room -very helpful for teens with electronic devices!  There were USB-enabled outlets on each side of each bed, along with individual spotlights on each side of each bed.    

The bathroom was small but new and very clean.
