One issue I did have was with respect to storage in the bathroom - there was only a single hook on the glass door to hang towels - not a towel bar anywhere, which made hanging wet towels difficult (especially since there were 4 of us and we were trying to be eco-conscious and re-use towels),  It would have been very helpful if there had been at least 2 more hooks to hang additional towels.  We ended up hanging towels over the desk chair and using one of our suitcases.  Not ideal, but not the end of the world either - we made it work. 

The location was really great for exploring all of Manhattan - easy walking distance to Penn Station (where I had taken the train from Newark airport). Also nearby to 5th Avenue shopping, Empire State Bldg, Broadway theaters, and Rockefeller Center - all within a mile or so (and walkable).  

Hot breakfast was a nice start to our day each day and when you are traveling with 3 teens, having it included was a nice perk!  Ample seating in the breakfast area and surrounding lobby made it such that we never lacked a place to sit -even in the later morning when the breakfast was more crowded.

One other (probably less talked about) perk was the coin-op guest laundry in the basement.  It was very handy to be able to throw in a couple of loads of laundry while having our breakfast one morning.  Front desk provided quarters for change.  My teenage sons also appreciated the new and very well-appointed 24-hour gym, also located on the lower level near the laundry.   Also a shout-out to the small business center with guest-available computers with internet access and a printer - super handy for checking into our flights and printing our boarding passes.

Overall, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again, and would recommend it for anyone traveling in NYC.

title: Family weekend
text: This hotel was great... super clean! The  breakfast was more than enough considering there were 7 of us . It was a perfect start to the day of much walking . The beds  were very comfortable . After a busy day of waking around it was nice to sit in the lobby and chat with family.  The location was excellent! I would definitely stay here again !

title: Tiny
text:
As a family of four, the room was very small (yes, I know we are in NYC). The beds were fine, bathroom was clean, and overall the room was nice. We were not able to use the couch/desk area because there was nowhere else to put our luggage due to the size of the room. 

The lobby was nice and the staff was friendly at every turn. Complimentary breakfast was a bonus with plenty to choose from. 

The location was very convenient and within walking distance to the Theater district, subway stations, and plenty of food options.

title: Hotel centrale e buoni servizi
text:
L'hotel é in posizione centralissima a soli 10 minuti da Times Square. La struttura sembra nuova, camere e spazi comuni moderni, si potrebbe migliorare la pulizia.
Camera molto confortevole con smart TV e accesso a Netflix. 
Colazione mediocre e personale abbastanza gentile. Nel complesso consigliato!

title: 3 rooms in 24 hrs and I would still go back
text:
Here’s the thing - check in was bad. We checked in on the app and were 1.5 hours late due to flight delays. Our room wasn’t ready for an hour or two and we rushed to get a room at 7:15 and get to an 8:00 that was 15 blocks away! The room was at the Springhill and SMALL. I was surprised, even for NYC. Although technically it would sleep 4 people, their bags wouldn’t fit as well (especially if they were all standing.) Wouldn’t work for 3 people for 8 nights. Ian suggested we touch base Sunday morning about alternate options. Melissa got us something Sunday and when we came back Ian got us into #2, at the Fairfield. We got up there after being out all day in 100 degree heat, took cold showers and ran off to our meeting. The AC wasn’t working and after a tech visit and several additional calls, they moved us again. 3rd room was a charm and we enjoyed a wonderful stay. 
Things to note: the elevator is slow, at best. And very crowded in the morning and late afternoon. Add some extra time into your schedule if you’re going down to breakfast. We had to give up on it a few days in because it was too much! Ice is only available on the 8th floor (so if you’re at the Fairfield - levels 15-27, be prepared for some stairs and elevator change.) Housekeeping - oh boy. Basically, the staff doesn’t have what they need on the floor so they have to travel to the basement to get supplies (toiletries, toilet paper, tissue, etc.) They are happy to do it - but don’t wait until you need it to ask for it. Be proactive!

title: Disappointed
text:
In general, I really like SpringHill Suites.  Given that, I will not be going back to this one.
Good points: beautiful lobby, large area for breakfast, really great and friendly doormen.
Bad points: person who checked me in acted like he wanted to be somewhere/anywhere else than here - not really friendly and provided no information on items such as breakfast and wi-fi, refrigerator did not work properly and appeared to have never been fixed even after two requests to the front desk, no wash cloths.
Net - I will go back to the SpringHill Suites on 37th Street in the future.

title: Quaint, yet comfortable
text:
This place feels brand new and is clean enough. There were a few scuffs and wine marks on the walls, but just a few. No big deal really. The bed was super comfortable, sheets were clean and lobby was also looking fairly new. The room was tiny, but it fit all the essentials - a king size bed, full bathroom, desk for working, chair, loveseat, closest, refrigerator, microwave and two end tables. It was efficiently laid out. 

One complaint I do have is, the loveset was FULL OF CRUMBS! If it weren't for the crumbs, this would have been a 4 star review. I literally had to remove the cushions and get all the crumbs off, then under cushions was like full of crumbs too! Wowzers! We ended up not sitting on it and placed our luggage on it. Oh well, can't be perfect.

The location is pretty good, down the street and a block from the subway stop. It is easy for Uber drivers to find and there is a lot of food available in walking distance.

title: Puny Rooms
text: The staff was nice, the gym was good and the breakfast buffet was well stocked, but the rooms were the smallest we have ever had in NYC! The bathroom vanity was non-existent, the desk and closet were tiny. We were so grateful that we didn't have to stay there for more than two nights and we will never go back again! This is a brand new hotel--there is no reason that they could not have made these rooms a little bigger! As Gold Members, we are so disappointed in Marriott these days. Hilton, here we come!

title: Tiny, Tiny Room
text: Our family of four (my husband, me, and our two boys age 9 & 10) stayed here in July 2019. The hotel is new and very clean, with modern furniture and pretty finishes. The staff is very accommodating and friendly. The complimentary breakfast is a major perk. However, our room was ridiculously tiny. We were tripping all over one another during our three-day stay. No room for suitcases, no closet (just a tiny wardrobe) and no dressers. No counter space in the bathroom...I had to put all of my toiletries on the floor space under the sink and basically knelt on the bathroom floor to get ready each morning. Kind of inconvenient, considering we spent nearly $300 each night to stay here. I wasn't in love with the area but it is very close to Times Square, Madison Square Garden, and multiple subway stations. I appreciated the nicely appointed gym, but wish that the televisions had been in working order. Running on a treadmill is mind-numbingly dull without the distraction of a television. All in all, I'm not sure I would recommend staying here, especially if you are traveling with a larger group or a lot of luggage.

Great hotel, in a really nice building. Looks like the building might have previously been a school. The lobby area and room furniture is all brand new. Very Conveniently located to Times Square and penn station.

title: Great location clean rooms
text: We stayed end of June 2019 for a weekend getaway with our 6 month baby. The bell boy was very sweet and always ran to open the door when we'd walk in and out of the hotel with baby in carrier or stroller. The staff was very helpfull and we had a king size bed for sharing (not sure how other rooms have the beds set up) The room is small, but we barely stayed in, c'mon this is nyc! Shower and sleep and just wanted it to be uber clean, which it was! The bed was fresh and clean at arrival and the bathroom also was very clean. Not much counter space in bathroom but we just had our products on the desk by the big mirror. Microwave and fridge in room. Ac working great (too great for the size of the room! Lol) The location is amazing! Walking around midtown, to central park, on 5th avenue everything is very close. Grab a water taxi by 42nd and 12th av and head to brooklyn. Was pleasantly surprised by the breakfast, hot cheese omelets, sceambled eggs, sausage/ham different breads/scones/muffins/croissants, waffles (the wait is barely like a minute and a half by person so people need to either wake up earlier (no line up at 7-8am) or be patient. Coffee was fresh and available all day at the lobby and iced citrus water. Breakfast also had packaged yogurts and fruits, alot of great options for snacks during the day and in the room. We booked last minute and got an amazing deal and were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel is fast access from the highway to the island by lincoln tunnel and out. No lurking around town in traffic to get to the hotel. Parking deal with an icon parking two blocks away to save some money. Great hotel, amazing location, will recommand and visit again for sure!!

title: Clean, modern and quiet - good location
text:
I was looking for a hotel for a mother/daughter weekend. It is so hard when there are "too many choices" like in NYC! I settled on this one because it was walking distance from Penn Station, and we had a positive experience. I was put off by some reviews of other hotels which talked about mold, mildew, etc. so I wanted to find a hotel that did not have that problem - I picked this one because it was recently modernized.

First off, the hotel is not easy to spot - it is on 36th between 8th and 9th, directly across from a DoubleTree which has a large sign/portico. So look for the DoubleTree, then look across the street. Although the location is Times Square South, it is not directly on Times Square (several blocks away) so the street was quiet.

The elevators are a bit slow, and there are 2 separate banks of them, but we didn't experience any super long waits. It says in the elevator that you need to use your key, but we did not find this to be the case - however, I would have preferred if we had to use our key because I would have felt more secure.

We stayed in room 1012 - I am putting this room number down because we had no problems with the air conditioning or anything else in the room. There was a small desk, couch and table which we just used to put our stuff on.  It wasn't a huge room but we didn't feel overly cramped - it is NYC so I wasn't expecting a large hotel room like somewhere in the Midwest.  The shower was nice and modern with porcelain tiles up the shower walls - the bathroom was a bit small but clean - I would have appreciated more counter space around the sink, but could work around it because we had that extra space of the desk in the room. 

If I were staying here for business and had to do some work the desk would have been just adequate, but since this was a personal trip it was fine. The wifi also worked and was not too slow.

The free breakfast was OK - there was a line each morning for the waffle machine, but we weren't using that so that didn't bother us. The scrambled eggs were very good, but the "croissants" were just bread in a croissant shape. The fruit was overripe (particularly the strawberries one day), but it was nice having fresh fruit available. There isn't any cold cereal that isn't sweetened - I would have preferred plain cornflakes or Cheerios instead of frosted flakes and Honey Nut Cheerios. And my daughter has a nut allergy so anything "Nut" is a problem.  They have Starbucks coffee. The milk machine is super slow so a lot of people were using the milk that was intended for the coffee on their cereal, so that meant the milk carafes ran out frequently. They also have water and coffee in the lobby. So all in all, breakfast is adequate and you can have better food later on in the day. If you want a bagel, there is a good bagel place less than a 5 min walk away (next to a "Subway" sandwich shop - I think it was Best Bagels on 35th - will look up and post the exact name later).

The bellhop who held our luggage was very friendly. I also got extra shampoo from a housekeeper who was also very friendly.

Overall I would recommend it if you want to be in this part of the city.

title: Air Conditioning Doesn’t Work
text: I had to call the front desk 3 times about my AC unit not working and had engineers in the room for over an hour total. Considering I paid nearly $1000 total for 3 nights, this shouldn’t be an issue. This is one of the worst Marriott properties I’ve ever stayed at.

title: Perfetto per noi!
text: Dopo una notte trascorsa in un appartamento, che non rispecchiava quello che ci aspettavamo, ci siamo trovati costretti a fissare al volo una nuova sistemazione e abbiamo trovato FORTUNATAMENTE questo super Hotel, il giorno stesso del nostro arrivo! Prenotiamo la mattina alle 8,00, arriviamo alle 8,30 e alle 8,40 eravamo già nella nostra camera! Buona pulizia. Staff giovane, educato e molto gentile. La nostra stanza aveva un letto matrimoniale molto comodo, tutte le mattine veniva rifatto e cambiata la biancheria. Siamo riusciti a riposare benissimo, nonostante la vicinanza a Times Square non si sentiva volare una mosca! Ogni camera dispone di uno smart tv dove è possibile vedere Netflix con il proprio account. A disposizione una macchina del caffè con 4 cialde che veniva rifornita giornalmente. Frigorifero e bottiglie di acqua di benvenuto. La palestra è accessibile a tutti e in qualsiasi orario. Il pezzo forte la colazione!! Ovviamente continentale, dolce e salata e super abbondante! Non mi dimenticherò mai i Waffel!! L'orario è ottimo perchè viene servita dal lun-ven dalle 6,30 alle 10,00 e sab e dome dalle 7,00 alle 11,00. La hall è molto grande, ed è possibile mangiarci cibo da asporto senza alcun problema. E' presente anche un bar dove è possibile sorseggiare cocktail. Per tutti gli ospiti caramelle o leccalecca sempre offerti, presenti sui banconi della reception. La Posizione è ottima per girare tutta NY! Le metro sono vicinissime e di facile raggiungimento! La più comoda girato l'angolo davanti il Madison Square! Fantastico in tutto! Ci ha reso la vacanza indimenticabile! Lo consigliamo vivamente!

title: Don’t be fooled
text: We’re NewYorkers from earlier days who love to return annually to experience our fabulous city. But we have one huge question: Why do visitors expect hotel rooms in NYC to be small or tiny because, well, it’s New York? This new Springhill Marriott is a brand new building incorporating elements of a former church. This hotel is uncomfortable in many ways. Everyone we met in the insufficient number of elevators openly shared how small the rooms are. But of course, “that’s New York” as we say. Millennials we beg you not to believe this myth. Don’t accept a room that you can’t turn around in even if it’s new and clean and in NYC. Also, the air conditioning is not sufficient, maybe on purpose? Can’t turn around in a room with two beds? Need to remove the ironing board from the tiny closet to make room for a few clothes? Why put up with this? Act up. Don’t stay here and demand more from the huge hotel monopolies. Thanks!

title: So much wasted potential......
text:
For Christmas each year, we gift a vacation to our grown kids and grandkids. This is a beautiful new (renovated) building in an awesome location! We booked Springhill because of the location, and made it very clear that we needed two rooms and wanted them to be side by side, or at least close, and was assured that could be accommodated. Mind you, we made reservations more than two months prior to our stay. Upon arrival, a couple of hours early for check in, we were told, "we'll do the best we can, but we had a full house last night". I somewhat understand, but what did "last night" have to do with a reservation made over two months ago??? Anyway, a very courteous bellhop took our bags to secure while we went out for a walk before checking in. Upon our return, rooms still not ready...at 4pm (check in time). We hang out in the lobby for awhile. It's 5pm or a little later before we are finally told our rooms are ready....one on each end of the building!!!!!!!!!! I guess we were expected to be happy they were on the same floor??? Cut to the chase, the A/C units in this new facility flat sucks, and they know it! We were told three different times in the first 36 hours of our stay, that the one room having the problems was "at the top of the list" to be fixed. Never any follow up, and apparently what one staff person told us, never was told to anyone else, so they had no clue! After changing rooms 3 times we finally ended up with rooms on the same end of the building, for the final 4 nights of our stay. I rate this place a 3 because of it's location, very congenial staff, and nice "looking" facility. The line of communication among that nice staff, and the complete junk HVAC system deserves a 1 at best.  
Hopefully, they can get it together soon. If my wife and I return to NYC, and only need a single room for ourselves, we will likely give them another chance, but won't consider them again for a family vacation.

title: Everything was the worst experience at any of the Marriott group hotels I have stayedz
text:
Service = Horrible
No one picks up a call when you use the phone in the room.
If someone ever picks up, you would probably have to wait for quite a while. 

Even if you make a house keeping request, you would still have to go find a housekeeping lady to get what you need.

Elevators are the slowest thing you would ever experience.

The room is definitely not clean. The floor is definitely not well cleaned and it feels old considering it’s listed as new on Marriott.

Worst of all, I requested the laundry to be picked up by 9am for the same day service, so they were supposed to deliver it by 7pm. 7pm comes, nothing is delivered, called the front desk  and they tell me nothing isn’t delivered to the hotel. 

This is absolutely the most unpleasant experience I had with the $250+/night hotel.

title: Tiny and Hot
text: We booked this hotel for a seven night stay while working a convention at the Javits. The location is good, the hotel is new with a very nice lobby and attractive furnishings. A bellman helped us to our room and apologized about how small the room was. We have stayed in many NYC rooms and this was by far the smallest I have ever seen. As another reviewer wrote, we could not walk between the beds and the wall to the bathroom or the door out without bumping the tv. We are both small women and I cannot imagine how a large man would do. It is interesting to see that photos show some larger rooms, even though we were told by the desk staff that there were not. We tried to settle into the room, but there is virtually no place to put anything away and absolutely nowhere to put anything in the bathroom. We were considering finding another hotel the next morning. The air conditioner fan blew nonstop and that night it became clear the A/C was not working. I called the desk after a mostly sleepless night and was asked if they could send someone to fix it. We went out and on our return, the engineer was in the room saying that we could not stay there because he could not fix it. He volunteered that there was a problem and that we should never have been put in that room. Trying to make a very long story short, we were moved to a Fairfield room in the building with no mention of the fact that those rooms are cheaper.  I also asked if any rooms were larger and was told that only handicap accessible would be, but in traveler photos it does look like there is some variation in room sizes. The  breakfast is fine,  but the staff seemed to be having problems and could not get the waffle machines working right. If you were one person in a single bedded room, this hotel might work out ok. For a couple in one bed, it would be ok for a short trip. The room was clean.

title: Very good, brand new midtown hotel with a few minor wrinkles to iron out
text:
The only reason I don’t give this 5 stars is because Springhill Suites are not 5-star-level hotels. But I like this hotel a lot and will definitely stay here again for the following reasons:
- very clean (my #1 criteria for hotels)
- close to Penn Station but away from the tourist crush
- comfortable room
- nice, helpful employees

Some items to note:
- as a brand new hotel, there are still some wrinkles to iron out. The most pressing one is that the AC doesn’t yet reliably work in all the rooms. If you get to your room and it’s not cool, check the vents to see if cold air is coming out. If not, go down and politely request another room if possible (or at least a maintenance fix). 
- it’s a NYC hotel so don’t expect a large room even though it’s called a “suite”. I’d guess ~150 sqft. But it has everything you need - bed, sofa, desk, chair, bathroom, fridge, microwave. The only drawers are in the side tables so my only real complaint is the lack of dresser drawers. No extra space in the room, but it’s NYC so get out and enjoy the city!

title: Amazing Service and Location
text: I stayed at this hotel with guests visiting NYC for the first time.  Every staff member greeted us and were exceedingly kind and helpful.  The location was perfect! The hotel is in Midtown but very close to Chelsea with many gorgeous parks and fun bars! We are definitely coming back!

title: Nice rooms but no housekeeping
text:
We stayed here for 6 nights and unfortunately, housekeeping only managed to come on one occasion. On that one occasion, soaps and teas and bottled water were not replenished too, unsure if this is the norm. 

Check in: Check in was efficient and fast, staff was friendly. We were given a small bag of snacks too.

Room: As per NYC standards, rooms were small but functional. There was a sofa in the corner but the room seemed much smaller than the advertised 23-26sq m2. Beds were nice and comfortable. A small refrigerator and microwave oven were provided, with some sets of disposable cutlery and cups which came in handy. The toilet is small but very clean and spotless but this is probably due to the hotel being new. As housekeeping does not come everyday, I wonder if they will be able to maintain the cleanliness of the rooms in the long term. 

Breakfast: Breakfast was better than expected but the items repeated everyday. Chobani yogurt is provided and the scrambled eggs bowl was delicious. Extra points for the coffee bar which had different types of milk and syrups available. A good variety of pastries were available too. 

Location: Conveniently located near to Penn Station (take 35 Street 8 Ave exits), about 6mins walk away. Also about 8mins walk from Port Authority Bus Station. Hudsons Yard  is within walking distance too. Feels safe at night too.

title: Nice hotel but tiny rooms
text:
Really nice and clean new hotel.  
The 2 queen bed room we had was tiny.  Not much space between the end of the bed and the wall and with the tv on the wall made it difficult to get around and it resulted in several bruises from the bed frame.   Also - there was 2 of us in the room for 6 nights and really not much space to store clothes and toiletries and make up and no space to but our luggage.   We didn't have a sofa as most pictures showed (no room for it).
However, we were grateful to get a room with a huge terrace (it actually looked almost as big as the room) but there was no chairs to sit on the terrace. We asked at reception and was told there were none. Kinda wonder what the point of the terrace is if no chairs to sit on it.   We went to Target on the night we arrived and bought 2 fold away chairs at $20 each and have left them in the room so others can use them too.
I was concerned about the previous comments about the a/c.  Our didn't go below 65 but wasn't as bad as I was expecting but then again we were able to open the terrace door to get some air.
Apart from that - loved the hotel.  
Location great, breakfast options were great too and friendly staff and the coin laundry was useful too.

title: Weekend getaway
text: We really enjoyed staying here. In fact we returned the very next month. The hotel is brand new, great breakfast, conveniently located, friendly staff, reasonably priced! Definitely will be staying again in the future!

title: Great Location! Friendly Staff! Excellent Breakfast!
text:
LOCATION:

One of the key selling features for me was that it's located within short walking distance from Port Authority, Times Squares and the Bella Abzug Park (Hudson Yards).  

BREAKFAST:

Our stay included a breakfast buffet that was excellent with lots of selection of both hot and cold items, pastries, waffles and fruits.

ROOM:

Rooms was great and larger than most in this price range! Everything was clean and brand new. Quiet room and comfortable beds!

SERVICE:

The staff was professional, friendly and service-oriented. You can tell they are well-trained to take care of guests. Cleaning staff also did a great job maintaining our room.

title: Lots of work to do still
text: When coming in we were surprised to see how pretty the hotel looks. Everything is new and fresh. Also the bell men were friendly and welcoming. Front desk staff was kind, however very robotic. Everything seemed scripted. The suite is just a room really, even for European standards. We had the tiniest bathroom ever seen in a hotel. However, it is all super functional. Two things which were really negative were NOISE.. from the hallway and adjacent rooms. Such a new hotel, but sound insulation is zero to none... The second point is housekeeping service. It lacked. Trash was left in room, bathroom not cleaned, iron was left in room, bed not properly made. They need to work on that drastically. The buffet breakfast however is amazing. They maintain the buffet very well and the restaurant is clean. A big plus is the outside patio where you can have breakfast. All in all I think they need to invest in training still which can make the hotel a better place.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: Brand new hotel in a great location.  The staff was friendly and inviting, clearly very proud to show off their new hotel.  The lobby is beautiful and expansive! I learned from the staff that a church occupied the site previously and the architect included the original facade and beautiful ceiling in the construction of the hotel.  The guest room was well appointed.  I particularly liked the oversized chair with desk stand - it was a comfortable space in which to work.  The WiFi speed was fast.  The bed was dreamy. The breakfast room is huge with an incredible selection of hot and cold items; very satisfying.  There is a lounge in the lobby at which we enjoyed light bites and drinks.  This hotel offered us everything we needed for a comfortable and convenient stay.  The location is great.  From the hotel, we walked to the Javits Center, Hudson Yards, Broadway theater district and the Highline Park.    Subway lines are one block away.  Also, there are many dining options in the neighborhood.  I look forward to my next trip to NYC; I will definitely stay here again.

title: Functional rooms but no upkeep
text: We rented 2 rooms for 3 nights.  They are small but functional, with adequate amenities. The problem arose when neither room was cleaned after the first day. We mentioned it at the reception desk; one room still didn't get cleaned; the other's bed was made and shower cleaned, but the trash cans were left full, coffee wasn't replenished and neither was toilet paper.  We mentioned it again and they sent a cleaning crew at 7pm just as everyone was getting ready for the evening (so we sent them away). The excuse was "the hotel was full" and it's our job to remind them... Reception desk staff ranged from wonderful and friendly to completely clueless.  It's too bad because the hotel has potential and the rooms, while really small, would've been adequate (as long as you don't want to spend a lot of time in them...).

title: READ THIS BEFORE YOU RESERVE AND STAY AT THIS HOTEL
text:
If you decide to stay here, READ THIS!!!! DO NO STAY IF THEY HAVE NOT FIX THE AC DURING SUMMER. MOST ROOMS HAVE THE SAME ISSUES AND THEY KNOW IT. OUR STAY: MAY 19, 2019

We stayed one night at Courtyard hotel Herald Square the first night and it was amazing. We decided to reserve the second night at this hotel because its location near Penn Station for us to easily go to Metlife Stadium for Concert and Newark Airport the day after our stay. I was a Titanium Elite and had a late check-out at 4PM on the first hotel. However, I received a notification that my key was ready at this hotel around 11AM. Therefore, we decided to move to this hotel so we can go to Metlife Stadium for BTS concert earlier. This was the start of all the TROUBLES.

When we got to this hotel, Karina was check us in. Of course, no status recognition or thank you being a loyal customers which was okay for me because they allowed us to check-in early. She cannot find my reservation and said it was cancelled. It was crazy because I even received the mobile key. I then gave her my confirmation/reservation number and she found it. We were given room 1406. (The hotel itself was both Fairfield Floor 15 and above & Springhill Suites Floor 2 -14 combined at the same building). I was given the high floor as I was requested before check-in. The room was very small with 2 queens and no complimentary bottle waters which was fine for us. The room itself was clean. However, the AC was off and it was very hot like 74F same as outside temperature. We then turn on the AC and set it to 65F. After 30 minutes, the AC did not have any cool air flow instead it was a hot air flow. The temperature reach 79F and we have to open the door as we are sweating and too hot inside the room. I called the receptionist and she said that she will send technician to fix it now. We wait one hour in a hot room and sweating. We saw the Director of Front Office, Colllin Carroll while she was checking on other rooms and tolh her our concern. She then radio to send to have technician come to look at. After 30 minutes, still no technician. I decided to go downstairs and bring the technician with me. Sal, the technician look at the AC and decided that we need to move to another room as the AC is not working right and have to be pull out. He called the receptionist but no rooms available until 4PM. He let us know that the hotel should compensate us. We hauled our luggage back to lobby to store as we need to get ready to go to MetLife Stadium. We waste so much time just to wait for technician to look at the AC.

I talked to Melissa, another receptionist and ask for compensation. She was agree and offer 5000 points. As we are about to leave, there is another girl who had the same concern and was offered full refund as she talked to the Director of Front Office, Collin Carroll. I then told her about our room too and she also gave us full refund (free stay) which was weird. She then check to see if there was a room available with 2 queens which was not. We told her that we had to leave now and we will get our room when we were back from the concert. She was okay and will get the key ready when we were back.

When we were back around 11:30PM, Nema, the receptionist did not have the key and our room still 1406. I requested to talk to Joey, the overnight Manager. He helped us to get our room ready which is located at 1417. He also helped us with our luggage which was very nice of him. The room was located in the corner and have bigger room than 1406. Also, have two complimentary bottle waters. However, the room temperature was 75F and it was very hot. We then set the AC to 65. After couple hours, the room was not getting cold and the temperature raise to 78F again. At this times, it was 1:30AM already and we were sweating like crazy and not be able to sleep. We called receptionist and offer technician to look at the AC. We refused as this was the second time and request for another room. However, they were no longer have two queens. I requested to move to King room better than inside this hot room. The receptionist went up to our room 1417 and gave us the key. She also mentioned that their hotel had been had the A/C issues.We were moved to Room 520. The room was spacious and have two complimentary waters also. When we entered the room, it was cool like 70F. It was better than previous two. However, as we slept, the temperature raise to 79F again and we cannot sleep and sweating all night. This stay was the worst stay ever in my life. Even it is free but it is a waste of your time and I needed to file a complaint thru Marriott Customer Service. We waste our vacation in New York. We did not even enjoy the breakfast as we finally fell asleep in the morning for two hours before we were leaving to Newark Airport. We finally can sleep for two hours because I kept playing with the thermostat. I finally figured out if we set to 65F, it will give hot air instead of cool air. However, if we set to 77F, the AC will start and blow cool air. I assume they connected it the wrong way. However, this did not solve the problems because all the AC was locked in AUTO mode. If I set it to 77F, the temperature will drop from 79F to 75F. As the set point was at 77F, the AC will stop and no longer blowing until we adjust the set point again. This is totally ridiculuos.

title: Just ok
text:
This is a new property with many problems. In my first room there was a ticking noise from the aircon. In my second room one could here the water flow from the whole building. Hey just to be clear I am normally not bothered about some noise level. 
On the 6th floor the elevators were wrongly wired so one had to press up to go down. The fitness is great with brand new Lifefitness equipments and a TRX. The location is actually much better then I thought. It is walking distance to Hudson Yard, the High Line and to the Penn station.

title: Melhor experiência que tive em Manhattan
text:
Fomos recebido pelo recepcionista Caique, que além de ser brasileiro, muito gentil e nos deu muitas dicas de NY. Os demais funcionários também foram muito atenciosos
Nosso quarto apesar de ser médio para pequeno, tinha uma cama king, frigobar, microondas e uma tv enorme em 4k. O café da manhã era maravilhoso, muitas opções de comida e servidor em um enorme espaço. O hotel tem 3 semanas que abriu e está tudo lindo e novinho. Localização fica há 5min da Times square.

title: Brand New, Great location, Free breakfast, but TINY rooms
text:
I recently stayed 1 night at the brand new Springhill Suites Times Square South.  This hotel has only been open for about a month, and shares the lobby and facilities with a Fairfield Inn.  The Springhill rooms are on the lower floors and the Fairfield rooms are on the upper floors. 
First on the location, the hotel calls itself "Times Square South" but be aware the hotel is on West 36th Street, between 8th and 9th.  It's a bit of a walk to the heart of Times Square.  But the hotel is 2 blocks from Penn Station, MSG, and major subway lines like the A-C-E and 1-2-3 lines. 
Check in was fast and friendly and I was quickly on my way to my room on the 6th floor.  Be aware that this is actually a good size hotel, and there can be LONG waits for the elevator to come, especially to the individual floors.  I was given a room directly across from the elevator doors even though I have in my profile to be far from the elevators. I didn't love hearing people chatting outside my door late at night and early in the morning.
My room was perfect for a solo business traveler for one night.  It would have been great for multiple nights.  But the room is SMALL.  I mean typical NYC small, but still it would be tight for 2 or 3 people.  The room has the layout of a typical Springhill Suite room just crammed in.  This actually made it hard to work at the desk, as I couldn't pull the desk chair out far enough to sit in it easily because it bumped against the couch!!  The room has a small closet with ironing board, iron, safe, and there were a couple of bottles of free water.  
There were plenty of outlets and USB charging spots everywhere, which was great, and the WiFi was free and very fast.  The TV was HUGE and had Marriott's internet TV with access to YouTube, Hulu, Netflix, etc....
The bed was clean, super comfortable, and the AC in the room worked great.  IN the morning the shower was hot and powerful and the bathroom had great lighting.  
A great bonus for NYC is the free breakfast in the lobby. It's typical Springhill/Fairfield breakfast, meaning simple eggs, bacon, cereals, yogurt, coffee, fruit, etc... Perfect to start the day and there were two main stations of food to help handle the crowds.  the breakfast staff was very friendly as well. 
Overall I really like this hotel.  I like the Springhill Brand for its business layout rooms and good value, and this hotel did not disappoint, even in NYC!

title: Very, nice clean room & Attentive Staff
text: I just spent  my first night at this new property at such a great, quiet location. I was on the 12th floor (Springhill Suites are on the bottom half /  Fairfield Inn on the top half) and heard no noise whatsoever. Though I had checked in with the mobile app, I thought there would be a separate Bonvoy Elite lane to pickup your keys. Instead, it was long line of guests and only one  staff was working  Saturday night. The breakfast room was huge, serving both Springhill & Fairfield guests. It was a very nice breakfast buffet — open till 11am, that’s a first to me. Also a first was offering agave syrup and Chobani Greek yogurts, where I have not seen before at Springhill, Fairfield or even Residence Inns. Ivana, who assisted me the next day late check-out, was so professional and very understanding. I mentioned to her that I was supposed to receive a free drink voucher for the hotel bar, per the promotion stated when using mobile check-in. She understood the promotion and offered me the beverage, even though she said the hotel doesn’t honor it. She said she will bring this promo up to management, as she has been approached by this promo before by other guests. Again, perhaps the hotel is still new. Nevertheless, I enjoyed my stay. Next time returning, I will book for the Fairfield Inn room above to test it out.

title: No Air Condition
text: Dont stay here in warm weather. The rooms are equipped with brand new failing a/c units. The service engineer is well aware of issue. The hotel chain itself does not care. If you stay here and have a/c issues demand extra points or free rooms. This hotel is brand new and has numerous units that DO NOT WORK. Avoid staying here. We switched rooms numerous times, contacted front desk numerous times & spoke with service tech.

title: Fantastic!!
text:
Moved here for a couple nights as a last minute booking because our last hotel was terrible and thank god we moved. This hotel is fantastic! Location is a short walk to times sq. The rooms are brand new, small as all NY rooms but feels a lot bigger because they are set out and planned in a spacious way. Had a fridge, microwave, coffee brewer, water. Bedding is so comfy, and a large king bed. bathroom clean and spacious with proper shower. big tv.
breakfast buffet is amazing, eggs bacon waffles yoghurt etc. 
Although we were given a room outside the elevator, noise is minimal outside.
love this hotel.

Lawrance & Heidi

title: Great service
text:
The hotel is very nice- be aware you're not staying in a "suite."  It's a hotel room, and it's relatively small (not tiny).  Everything was spotless and stylish and comfortable, though. 

The staff deserves a specific shoutout- they are fantastic.  The doormen won't let you touch the door and I had an employee actually run ahead of me to open a door to the basement for me.  I also saw staff walking around the lobby offering free bottles of water to people who were sitting there.  Excellent location, great employees, and a nice looking hotel at a decent price.  Will stay here again next time I am in the area.

title: Not so much
text: A Marriott property mid changeover from a Fairfield to a Springhill. Fairly nice newish property targeting 20-30 something travelers. A bit millennial  too cool. Great beds. Announced today that the water would be turned off for  the whole block at 8AM tomorrow . It was posted  on paper in the elevators ( 2  elevators for 26 floors, one wasn’t working) , in a  “valued guest” memo. We are in fact so valued that....nothing. We asked about the breakfast supposed to  run until 10 :  “ Well , I dunno.” The are customer friendly ways to handle unexpected disruptions. Fair hill hasn’t got them.

title: Great Stay
text: Spent a Friday night into Sat morning in this beautiful brand new hotel. Staff and service was excellent, so friendly and knowledgeable of local restaurants and fun spots in walking distance to hotel. The place was very clean and accommodating and the stay was so comfortable. Complimentary breakfast next day was amazing. Highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay again, hopefully longer than just one night.

title: Weekend vacation
text:
This is one of my favourite hotels to stay at in Manhattan. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. I was very happy that it is also pet friendly because I hate being away from my dogs. THEY HAD FUN TOO.
Breakfast was great!!! With a little of everything.
The staff was very courteous, friendly and helpful. 
This hotel is in the middle of all the great places to visit in NYC, Including Hudson Yards.  Nearby train stations gives easy access to The wonderful Central Park and Museums.Cannot wait for my next exciting Weekend in NYC. I now have the RIGHT HOTEL IN THE RIGHT PLACE.

title: Great 3 nights in Manhattan
text: We recently stayed at this brand new hotel on a recent trip to NYC. Not only was this hotel so centrally located (steps away from Penn Station and the new Hudson Yards) but it's brand new and absolutely beautiful. The lobby is spacious and modern with a great bar/cocktail area. There is also a very large breakfast room that includes outdoor seating in the warmer weather. Just beautiful. Our room was well appointed with a very comfortable bed and modern bathroom and sitting/desk area. The room was also very quiet which is not easy in midtown Manhattan. The breakfast was included and was wonderful. I have never had scrambled eggs that were this good at any other breakfast buffet. I had them every morning. The best part, though, was the extremely friendly and accommodating staff. They made us feel welcomed and comfortable from the moment we stepped in the hotel. I highly recommend this for business or leisure. We will definitely be back!

title: Great location, great rooms, awesome breakfast, and excellent staff!
text:
Great location near Times Square and short walk to trains.  Rooms are tight but functional and comfortable.  There has been a recent renovation and the place looks modern and great!  

The gym is brand new and well equipped - my only complaint is the lack of natural light in the gym, but you are in the basement!!

The free breakfast was awesome - not your typical continental breakfast, included a variety of hot foods (bacon, sausage, eggs) and make your own waffles!  And breakfast ended at 11 instead of 930 like most places!!

What stood out the most, was the amazing staff who were friendly and helpful.  I was particularly impressed by the doormen and wait staff!  Always helpful and attentive!  Definitely recommend!

title: Really nice place
text:
Stayed there for Friday and Saturday night.  We love the place because of how clean and great the service was.  The staffs were very helpful and accommodating . The complimentary breakfast was excellent and we were surprised of how many Healthy options they have.  Can’t complain about anything and we definitely will stay there again! 

M Nguyen

title: Great Location and Beautiful Hotel
text:
I stayed at the Springhill with my husband and my 3 year old in a double queen room and I thought it was a decent size room with a great view of Manhattan
Location is great! 3 blocks away from Penn Station, 4 blocks away from Port Authority and close by the Subways.
Breakfast was amazing, they serve hot breakfast, waffles and Starbucks coffee which is always a plus!
I'll definitely return :)

title: Family city trip
text:
We stayed Friday night at springhill suites with my 2 kids. We had a great time, the double queen bedroom was a decently size for family in nyc area,it even had a small couch area. loved the decor and location. It was 5 blocks from hudson yards which we got to eat lunch and enjoy the new mall area. 

We loved the bedroom/bathroom decor and front lobby had touch screen for the kids to draw on while we got drinks at the Bar1905. The kids love having complementary lollipops as usual. Staff and especially bell service was super nice and patience with me going in and out of the hotel with my kids and giant stroller. Valet is available at this location, big plus for us.
